146 /**
147  * HRegion stores data for a certain region of a table.  It stores all columns
148  * for each row. A given table consists of one or more HRegions.
149  *
150  * <p>We maintain multiple HStores for a single HRegion.
151  *
152  * <p>An Store is a set of rows with some column data; together,
153  * they make up all the data for the rows.
154  *
155  * <p>Each HRegion has a 'startKey' and 'endKey'.
156  * <p>The first is inclusive, the second is exclusive (except for
157  * the final region)  The endKey of region 0 is the same as
158  * startKey for region 1 (if it exists).  The startKey for the
159  * first region is null. The endKey for the final region is null.
160  *
161  * <p>Locking at the HRegion level serves only one purpose: preventing the
162  * region from being closed (and consequently split) while other operations
163  * are ongoing. Each row level operation obtains both a row lock and a region
164  * read lock for the duration of the operation. While a scanner is being
165  * constructed, getScanner holds a read lock. If the scanner is successfully
166  * constructed, it holds a read lock until it is closed. A close takes out a
167  * write lock and consequently will block for ongoing operations and will block
168  * new operations from starting while the close is in progress.
169  *
170  * <p>An HRegion is defined by its table and its key extent.
171  *
172  * <p>It consists of at least one Store.  The number of Stores should be
173  * configurable, so that data which is accessed together is stored in the same
174  * Store.  Right now, we approximate that by building a single Store for
175  * each column family.  (This config info will be communicated via the
176  * tabledesc.)
177  *
178  * <p>The HTableDescriptor contains metainfo about the HRegion's table.
179  * regionName is a unique identifier for this HRegion. (startKey, endKey]
180  * defines the keyspace for this HRegion.
181  */
182 public class HRegion implements HeapSize { // , Writable{

191    * master as a region to close if the carrying regionserver is overloaded.
192    * Once set, it is never cleared.
193    */
194   final AtomicBoolean closing = new AtomicBoolean(false);

250   // The internal wait duration to acquire a lock before read/update
251   // from the region. It is not per row. The purpose of this wait time
252   // is to avoid waiting a long time while the region is busy, so that
253   // we can release the IPC handler soon enough to improve the
254   // availability of the region server. It can be adjusted by
255   // tuning configuration "hbase.busy.wait.duration".
256   final long busyWaitDuration;
257   static final long DEFAULT_BUSY_WAIT_DURATION = HConstants.DEFAULT_HBASE_RPC_TIMEOUT;
258 
259   // If updating multiple rows in one call, wait longer,
260   // i.e. waiting for busyWaitDuration * # of rows. However,
261   // we can limit the max multiplier.
262   final int maxBusyWaitMultiplier;

264   // Max busy wait duration. There is no point to wait longer than the RPC
265   // purge timeout, when a RPC call will be terminated by the RPC engine.
266   final long maxBusyWaitDuration;

279   /**
280    * @return The smallest mvcc readPoint across all the scanners in this
281    * region. Writes older than this readPoint, are included  in every
282    * read operation.
283    */
284   public long getSmallestReadPoint() {
285     long minimumReadPoint;
286     // We need to ensure that while we are calculating the smallestReadPoint
287     // no new RegionScanners can grab a readPoint that we are unaware of.
288     // We achieve this by synchronizing on the scannerReadPoints object.
289     synchronized(scannerReadPoints) {
290       minimumReadPoint = mvcc.memstoreReadPoint();
291 
292       for (Long readPoint: this.scannerReadPoints.values()) {
293         if (readPoint < minimumReadPoint) {
294           minimumReadPoint = readPoint;
295         }
296       }
297     }
298     return minimumReadPoint;
299   }
300   /*
301    * Data structure of write state flags used coordinating flushes,
302    * compactions and closes.
303    */
304   static class WriteState {
305     // Set while a memstore flush is happening.
306     volatile boolean flushing = false;
307     // Set when a flush has been requested.
308     volatile boolean flushRequested = false;
309     // Number of compactions running.
310     volatile int compacting = 0;
311     // Gets set in close. If set, cannot compact or flush again.
312     volatile boolean writesEnabled = true;
313     // Set if region is read-only
314     volatile boolean readOnly = false;
315 
316     /**
317      * Set flags that make this region read-only.
318      *
319      * @param onOff flip value for region r/o setting
320      */
321     synchronized void setReadOnly(final boolean onOff) {
322       this.writesEnabled = !onOff;
323       this.readOnly = onOff;
324     }
325 
326     boolean isReadOnly() {
327       return this.readOnly;
328     }
329 
330     boolean isFlushRequested() {
331       return this.flushRequested;
332     }
333 
334     static final long HEAP_SIZE = ClassSize.align(
335         ClassSize.OBJECT + 5 * Bytes.SIZEOF_BOOLEAN);
336   }

400   /**
401    * HRegion constructor.  his constructor should only be used for testing and
402    * extensions.  Instances of HRegion should be instantiated with the
403    * {@link HRegion#newHRegion(Path, HLog, FileSystem, Configuration, HRegionInfo, HTableDescriptor, RegionServerServices)} method.
404    *
405    *
406    * @param tableDir qualified path of directory where region should be located,
407    * usually the table directory.
408    * @param log The HLog is the outbound log for any updates to the HRegion
409    * (There's a single HLog for all the HRegions on a single HRegionServer.)
410    * The log file is a logfile from the previous execution that's
411    * custom-computed for this HRegion. The HRegionServer computes and sorts the
412    * appropriate log info for this HRegion. If there is a previous log file
413    * (implying that the HRegion has been written-to before), then read it from
414    * the supplied path.
415    * @param fs is the filesystem.
416    * @param conf is global configuration settings.
417    * @param regionInfo - HRegionInfo that describes the region
418    * is new), then read them from the supplied path.
419    * @param rsServices reference to {@link RegionServerServices} or null
420    *
421    * @see HRegion#newHRegion(Path, HLog, FileSystem, Configuration, HRegionInfo, HTableDescriptor, RegionServerServices)
422    */
423   public HRegion(Path tableDir, HLog log, FileSystem fs, Configuration conf,
424     final HRegionInfo regionInfo, final HTableDescriptor htd,
425       RegionServerServices rsServices) {
426     this.tableDir = tableDir;
427     this.comparator = regionInfo.getComparator();
428     this.log = log;
429     this.fs = fs;
430     this.conf = conf;
431     this.rowLockWaitDuration = conf.getInt("hbase.rowlock.wait.duration",
432                     DEFAULT_ROWLOCK_WAIT_DURATION);
433 
434     this.isLoadingCfsOnDemandDefault = conf.getBoolean(LOAD_CFS_ON_DEMAND_CONFIG_KEY, false);
435     this.regionInfo = regionInfo;
436     this.htableDescriptor = htd;
437     this.rsServices = rsServices;
438     this.threadWakeFrequency = conf.getLong(HConstants.THREAD_WAKE_FREQUENCY,
439         10 * 1000);
440     String encodedNameStr = this.regionInfo.getEncodedName();
441     setHTableSpecificConf();
442     this.regiondir = getRegionDir(this.tableDir, encodedNameStr);
443     this.scannerReadPoints = new ConcurrentHashMap<RegionScanner, Long>();
444     this.opMetrics = new OperationMetrics(conf, this.regionInfo);
445 
446     this.busyWaitDuration = conf.getLong(
447       "hbase.busy.wait.duration", DEFAULT_BUSY_WAIT_DURATION);
448     this.maxBusyWaitMultiplier = conf.getInt("hbase.busy.wait.multiplier.max", 2);
449     if (busyWaitDuration * maxBusyWaitMultiplier <= 0L) {
450       throw new IllegalArgumentException("Invalid hbase.busy.wait.duration ("
451         + busyWaitDuration + ") or hbase.busy.wait.multiplier.max ("
452         + maxBusyWaitMultiplier + "). Their product should be positive");
453     }
454     this.maxBusyWaitDuration = conf.getLong("ipc.client.call.purge.timeout",
455       2 * HConstants.DEFAULT_HBASE_RPC_TIMEOUT);
456 
457     /*
458      * timestamp.slop provides a server-side constraint on the timestamp. This
459      * assumes that you base your TS around currentTimeMillis(). In this case,
460      * throw an error to the user if the user-specified TS is newer than now +
461      * slop. LATEST_TIMESTAMP == don't use this functionality
462      */
463     this.timestampSlop = conf.getLong(
464         "hbase.hregion.keyvalue.timestamp.slop.millisecs",
465         HConstants.LATEST_TIMESTAMP);
466     // When hbase.regionserver.optionallogflushinterval <= 0 , deferred log sync is disabled.
467     this.deferredLogSyncDisabled = conf.getLong("hbase.regionserver.optionallogflushinterval",
468         1 * 1000) <= 0;
469     
470     if (rsServices != null) {
471       this.rsAccounting = this.rsServices.getRegionServerAccounting();
472       // don't initialize coprocessors if not running within a regionserver
473       // TODO: revisit if coprocessors should load in other cases
474       this.coprocessorHost = new RegionCoprocessorHost(this, rsServices, conf);
475     }
476     if (LOG.isDebugEnabled()) {
477       // Write out region name as string and its encoded name.
478       LOG.debug("Instantiated " + this);
479     }
480   }
481 
482   void setHTableSpecificConf() {
483     if (this.htableDescriptor == null) return;
484     LOG.info("Setting up tabledescriptor config now ...");
485     long flushSize = this.htableDescriptor.getMemStoreFlushSize();
486 
487     if (flushSize <= 0) {
488       flushSize = conf.getLong(HConstants.HREGION_MEMSTORE_FLUSH_SIZE,
489         HTableDescriptor.DEFAULT_MEMSTORE_FLUSH_SIZE);
490     }
491     this.memstoreFlushSize = flushSize;
492     this.blockingMemStoreSize = this.memstoreFlushSize *
493         conf.getLong("hbase.hregion.memstore.block.multiplier", 2);
494   }

496   /**
497    * Initialize this region.
498    * @return What the next sequence (edit) id should be.
499    * @throws IOException e
500    */
501   public long initialize() throws IOException {
502     return initialize(null);
503   }
504 
505   /**
506    * Initialize this region.
507    *
508    * @param reporter Tickle every so often if initialize is taking a while.
509    * @return What the next sequence (edit) id should be.
510    * @throws IOException e
511    */
512   public long initialize(final CancelableProgressable reporter)
513       throws IOException {
514 
515     MonitoredTask status = TaskMonitor.get().createStatus(
516         "Initializing region " + this);
517 
518     long nextSeqId = -1;
519     try {
520       nextSeqId = initializeRegionInternals(reporter, status);
521       return nextSeqId;
522     } finally {
523       // nextSeqid will be -1 if the initialization fails.
524       // At least it will be 0 otherwise.
525       if (nextSeqId == -1) {
526         status.abort("Exception during region " + this.getRegionNameAsString()
527             + " initialization.");
528       }
529     }
530   }
531 
532   private long initializeRegionInternals(final CancelableProgressable reporter,
533       MonitoredTask status) throws IOException, UnsupportedEncodingException {
534     if (coprocessorHost != null) {
535       status.setStatus("Running coprocessor pre-open hook");
536       coprocessorHost.preOpen();
537     }
538 
539     // Write HRI to a file in case we need to recover .META.
540     status.setStatus("Writing region info on filesystem");
541     checkRegioninfoOnFilesystem();
542 
543     // Remove temporary data left over from old regions
544     status.setStatus("Cleaning up temporary data from old regions");
545     cleanupTmpDir();
546 
547     // Load in all the HStores.
548     // Get minimum of the maxSeqId across all the store.
549     //
550     // Context: During replay we want to ensure that we do not lose any data. So, we
551     // have to be conservative in how we replay logs. For each store, we calculate
552     // the maxSeqId up to which the store was flushed. But, since different stores
553     // could have a different maxSeqId, we choose the
554     // minimum across all the stores.
555     // This could potentially result in duplication of data for stores that are ahead
556     // of others. ColumnTrackers in the ScanQueryMatchers do the de-duplication, so we
557     // do not have to worry.
558     // TODO: If there is a store that was never flushed in a long time, we could replay
559     // a lot of data. Currently, this is not a problem because we flush all the stores at
560     // the same time. If we move to per-cf flushing, we might want to revisit this and send
561     // in a vector of maxSeqIds instead of sending in a single number, which has to be the
562     // min across all the max.
563     long minSeqId = -1;
564     long maxSeqId = -1;
565     // initialized to -1 so that we pick up MemstoreTS from column families
566     long maxMemstoreTS = -1;
567 
568     if (this.htableDescriptor != null &&
569         !htableDescriptor.getFamilies().isEmpty()) {
570       // initialize the thread pool for opening stores in parallel.
571       ThreadPoolExecutor storeOpenerThreadPool =
572         getStoreOpenAndCloseThreadPool(
573           "StoreOpenerThread-" + this.regionInfo.getRegionNameAsString());
574       CompletionService<Store> completionService =
575         new ExecutorCompletionService<Store>(storeOpenerThreadPool);
576 
577       // initialize each store in parallel
578       for (final HColumnDescriptor family : htableDescriptor.getFamilies()) {
579         status.setStatus("Instantiating store for column family " + family);
580         completionService.submit(new Callable<Store>() {
581           public Store call() throws IOException {
582             return instantiateHStore(tableDir, family);
583           }
584         });
585       }
586       try {
587         for (int i = 0; i < htableDescriptor.getFamilies().size(); i++) {
588           Future<Store> future = completionService.take();
589           Store store = future.get();
590 
591           this.stores.put(store.getColumnFamilyName().getBytes(), store);
592           long storeSeqId = store.getMaxSequenceId();
593           if (minSeqId == -1 || storeSeqId < minSeqId) {
594             minSeqId = storeSeqId;
595           }
596           if (maxSeqId == -1 || storeSeqId > maxSeqId) {
597             maxSeqId = storeSeqId;
598           }
599           long maxStoreMemstoreTS = store.getMaxMemstoreTS();
600           if (maxStoreMemstoreTS > maxMemstoreTS) {
601             maxMemstoreTS = maxStoreMemstoreTS;
602           }
603         }
604       } catch (InterruptedException e) {
605         throw new IOException(e);
606       } catch (ExecutionException e) {
607         throw new IOException(e.getCause());
608       } finally {
609         storeOpenerThreadPool.shutdownNow();
610       }
611     }
612     mvcc.initialize(maxMemstoreTS + 1);
613     // Recover any edits if available.
614     maxSeqId = Math.max(maxSeqId, replayRecoveredEditsIfAny(
615         this.regiondir, minSeqId, reporter, status));
616 
617     status.setStatus("Cleaning up detritus from prior splits");
618     // Get rid of any splits or merges that were lost in-progress.  Clean out
619     // these directories here on open.  We may be opening a region that was
620     // being split but we crashed in the middle of it all.
621     SplitTransaction.cleanupAnySplitDetritus(this);
622     FSUtils.deleteDirectory(this.fs, new Path(regiondir, MERGEDIR));
623 
624     this.writestate.setReadOnly(this.htableDescriptor.isReadOnly());
625 
626     this.writestate.flushRequested = false;
627     this.writestate.compacting = 0;
628 
629     // Initialize split policy
630     this.splitPolicy = RegionSplitPolicy.create(this, conf);
631 
632     this.lastFlushTime = EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTimeMillis();
633     // Use maximum of log sequenceid or that which was found in stores
634     // (particularly if no recovered edits, seqid will be -1).
635     long nextSeqid = maxSeqId + 1;
636     LOG.info("Onlined " + this.toString() + "; next sequenceid=" + nextSeqid);
637 
638     // A region can be reopened if failed a split; reset flags
639     this.closing.set(false);
640     this.closed.set(false);
641 
642     if (coprocessorHost != null) {
643       status.setStatus("Running coprocessor post-open hooks");
644       coprocessorHost.postOpen();
645     }
646 
647     status.markComplete("Region opened successfully");
648     return nextSeqid;
649   }

669    */
670   public boolean hasReferences() {
671     for (Store store : this.stores.values()) {
672       for (StoreFile sf : store.getStorefiles()) {

680   /**
681    * This function will return the HDFS blocks distribution based on the data
682    * captured when HFile is created
683    * @return The HDFS blocks distribution for the region.
684    */
685   public HDFSBlocksDistribution getHDFSBlocksDistribution() {
686     HDFSBlocksDistribution hdfsBlocksDistribution =
687       new HDFSBlocksDistribution();
688     synchronized (this.stores) {
689       for (Store store : this.stores.values()) {
690         for (StoreFile sf : store.getStorefiles()) {
691           HDFSBlocksDistribution storeFileBlocksDistribution =
692             sf.getHDFSBlockDistribution();
693           hdfsBlocksDistribution.add(storeFileBlocksDistribution);
694         }
695       }
696     }
697     return hdfsBlocksDistribution;
698   }

700   /**
701    * This is a helper function to compute HDFS block distribution on demand
702    * @param conf configuration
703    * @param tableDescriptor HTableDescriptor of the table
704    * @param regionEncodedName encoded name of the region
705    * @return The HDFS blocks distribution for the given region.
706  * @throws IOException
707    */
708   static public HDFSBlocksDistribution computeHDFSBlocksDistribution(
709     Configuration conf, HTableDescriptor tableDescriptor,
710     String regionEncodedName) throws IOException {
711     HDFSBlocksDistribution hdfsBlocksDistribution =
712       new HDFSBlocksDistribution();
713     Path tablePath = FSUtils.getTablePath(FSUtils.getRootDir(conf),
714       tableDescriptor.getName());
715     FileSystem fs = tablePath.getFileSystem(conf);
716 
717     for (HColumnDescriptor family: tableDescriptor.getFamilies()) {
718       Path storeHomeDir = Store.getStoreHomedir(tablePath, regionEncodedName,
719       family.getName());
720       if (!fs.exists(storeHomeDir))continue;
721 
722       FileStatus[] hfilesStatus = null;
723       hfilesStatus = fs.listStatus(storeHomeDir);
724 
725       for (FileStatus hfileStatus : hfilesStatus) {
726         HDFSBlocksDistribution storeFileBlocksDistribution =
727           FSUtils.computeHDFSBlocksDistribution(fs, hfileStatus, 0,
728           hfileStatus.getLen());
729         hdfsBlocksDistribution.add(storeFileBlocksDistribution);
730       }
731     }
732     return hdfsBlocksDistribution;
733   }

770   /**
771    * Write out an info file under the region directory. Useful recovering mangled regions. If the
772    * regioninfo already exists on disk and there is information in the file, then we fast exit.
773    * @param regionInfo information about the region
774    * @param regiondir directory under which to write out the region info
775    * @param fs {@link FileSystem} on which to write the region info
776    * @param conf {@link Configuration} from which to extract specific file locations
777    * @throws IOException on unexpected error.
778    */
779   public static void writeRegioninfoOnFilesystem(HRegionInfo regionInfo, Path regiondir,
780       FileSystem fs, Configuration conf) throws IOException {
781     Path regioninfoPath = new Path(regiondir, REGIONINFO_FILE);
782     if (fs.exists(regioninfoPath)) {
783       if (fs.getFileStatus(regioninfoPath).getLen() > 0) {
784         return;
785       }
786 
787       LOG.info("Rewriting .regioninfo file at: " + regioninfoPath);
788       if (!fs.delete(regioninfoPath, false)) {
789         throw new IOException("Unable to remove existing " + regioninfoPath);
790       }
791     }
792 
793     // Create in tmpdir and then move into place in case we crash after
794     // create but before close.  If we don't successfully close the file,
795     // subsequent region reopens will fail the below because create is
796     // registered in NN.
797 
798     // first check to get the permissions
799     FsPermission perms = FSUtils.getFilePermissions(fs, conf,
800         HConstants.DATA_FILE_UMASK_KEY);
801 
802     // and then create the file
803     Path tmpPath = new Path(getTmpDir(regiondir), REGIONINFO_FILE);
804 
805     // if datanode crashes or if the RS goes down just before the close is called while trying to
806     // close the created regioninfo file in the .tmp directory then on next
807     // creation we will be getting AlreadyCreatedException.
808     // Hence delete and create the file if exists.
809     if (FSUtils.isExists(fs, tmpPath)) {
810       FSUtils.delete(fs, tmpPath, true);
811     }
812 
813     FSDataOutputStream out = FSUtils.create(fs, tmpPath, perms);
814 
815     try {
816       regionInfo.write(out);
817       out.write('\n');
818       out.write('\n');
819       out.write(Bytes.toBytes(regionInfo.toString()));
820     } finally {
821       out.close();
822     }
823     if (!HBaseFileSystem.renameDirForFileSystem(fs, tmpPath, regioninfoPath)) {
824       throw new IOException("Unable to rename " + tmpPath + " to " +
825         regioninfoPath);
826     }
827   }

829   /**
830    * @param fs
831    * @param dir
832    * @return An HRegionInfo instance gotten from the <code>.regioninfo</code> file under region dir
833    * @throws IOException
834    */
835   public static HRegionInfo loadDotRegionInfoFileContent(final FileSystem fs, final Path dir)
836   throws IOException {
837     Path regioninfo = new Path(dir, HRegion.REGIONINFO_FILE);
838     if (!fs.exists(regioninfo)) throw new FileNotFoundException(regioninfo.toString());
839     FSDataInputStream in = fs.open(regioninfo);
840     try {
841       HRegionInfo hri = new HRegionInfo();
842       hri.readFields(in);
843       return hri;
844     } finally {
845       in.close();
846     }
847   }

913   /**
914    * Close down this HRegion.  Flush the cache, shut down each HStore, don't
915    * service any more calls.
916    *
917    * <p>This method could take some time to execute, so don't call it from a
918    * time-sensitive thread.
919    *
920    * @return Vector of all the storage files that the HRegion's component
921    * HStores make use of.  It's a list of all HStoreFile objects. Returns empty
922    * vector if already closed and null if judged that it should not close.
923    *
924    * @throws IOException e
925    */
926   public List<StoreFile> close() throws IOException {
927     return close(false);
928   }
929 
930   private final Object closeLock = new Object();
931 
932   /**
933    * Close down this HRegion.  Flush the cache unless abort parameter is true,
934    * Shut down each HStore, don't service any more calls.
935    *
936    * This method could take some time to execute, so don't call it from a
937    * time-sensitive thread.
938    *
939    * @param abort true if server is aborting (only during testing)
940    * @return Vector of all the storage files that the HRegion's component
941    * HStores make use of.  It's a list of HStoreFile objects.  Can be null if
942    * we are not to close at this time or we are already closed.
943    *
944    * @throws IOException e
945    */
946   public List<StoreFile> close(final boolean abort) throws IOException {
947     // Only allow one thread to close at a time. Serialize them so dual
948     // threads attempting to close will run up against each other.
949     MonitoredTask status = TaskMonitor.get().createStatus(
950         "Closing region " + this +
951         (abort ? " due to abort" : ""));
952 
953     status.setStatus("Waiting for close lock");
954     try {
955       synchronized (closeLock) {
956         return doClose(abort, status);
957       }
958     } finally {
959       status.cleanup();
960     }
961   }
962 
963   private List<StoreFile> doClose(
964       final boolean abort, MonitoredTask status)
965   throws IOException {
966     if (isClosed()) {
967       LOG.warn("Region " + this + " already closed");
968       return null;
969     }
970 
971     if (coprocessorHost != null) {
972       status.setStatus("Running coprocessor pre-close hooks");
973       this.coprocessorHost.preClose(abort);
974     }
975 
976     status.setStatus("Disabling compacts and flushes for region");
977     boolean wasFlushing = false;
978     synchronized (writestate) {
979       // Disable compacting and flushing by background threads for this
980       // region.
981       writestate.writesEnabled = false;
982       wasFlushing = writestate.flushing;
983       LOG.debug("Closing " + this + ": disabling compactions & flushes");
984       waitForFlushesAndCompactions();
985     }
986     // If we were not just flushing, is it worth doing a preflush...one
987     // that will clear out of the bulk of the memstore before we put up
988     // the close flag?
989     if (!abort && !wasFlushing && worthPreFlushing()) {
990       status.setStatus("Pre-flushing region before close");
991       LOG.info("Running close preflush of " + this.getRegionNameAsString());
992       internalFlushcache(status);
993     }
994 
995     this.closing.set(true);
996     status.setStatus("Disabling writes for close");
997     // block waiting for the lock for closing
998     lock.writeLock().lock();
999     try {
1000       if (this.isClosed()) {
1001         status.abort("Already got closed by another process");
1002         // SplitTransaction handles the null
1003         return null;
1004       }
1005       LOG.debug("Updates disabled for region " + this);
1006       // Don't flush the cache if we are aborting
1007       if (!abort) {
1008         internalFlushcache(status);
1009       }
1010 
1011       List<StoreFile> result = new ArrayList<StoreFile>();
1012       if (!stores.isEmpty()) {
1013         // initialize the thread pool for closing stores in parallel.
1014         ThreadPoolExecutor storeCloserThreadPool =
1015           getStoreOpenAndCloseThreadPool("StoreCloserThread-"
1016             + this.regionInfo.getRegionNameAsString());
1017         CompletionService<ImmutableList<StoreFile>> completionService =
1018           new ExecutorCompletionService<ImmutableList<StoreFile>>(
1019             storeCloserThreadPool);
1020 
1021         // close each store in parallel
1022         for (final Store store : stores.values()) {
1023           completionService
1024               .submit(new Callable<ImmutableList<StoreFile>>() {
1025                 public ImmutableList<StoreFile> call() throws IOException {
1026                   return store.close();
1027                 }
1028               });
1029         }
1030         try {
1031           for (int i = 0; i < stores.size(); i++) {
1032             Future<ImmutableList<StoreFile>> future = completionService
1033                 .take();
1034             ImmutableList<StoreFile> storeFileList = future.get();
1035             result.addAll(storeFileList);
1036           }
1037         } catch (InterruptedException e) {
1038           throw new IOException(e);
1039         } catch (ExecutionException e) {
1040           throw new IOException(e.getCause());
1041         } finally {
1042           storeCloserThreadPool.shutdownNow();
1043         }
1044       }
1045       this.closed.set(true);
1046 
1047       if (coprocessorHost != null) {
1048         status.setStatus("Running coprocessor post-close hooks");
1049         this.coprocessorHost.postClose(abort);
1050       }
1051       this.opMetrics.closeMetrics(this.getRegionInfo().getEncodedName());
1052       status.markComplete("Closed");
1053       LOG.info("Closed " + this);
1054       return result;
1055     } finally {
1056       lock.writeLock().unlock();
1057     }
1058   }
1059 
1060   /**
1061    * Wait for all current flushes and compactions of the region to complete.
1062    * <p>
1063    * Exposed for TESTING.
1064    */
1065   public void waitForFlushesAndCompactions() {
1066     synchronized (writestate) {
1067       while (writestate.compacting > 0 || writestate.flushing) {
1068         LOG.debug("waiting for " + writestate.compacting + " compactions"
1069             + (writestate.flushing ? " & cache flush" : "") + " to complete for region " + this);
1070         try {
1071           writestate.wait();
1072         } catch (InterruptedException iex) {
1073           // essentially ignore and propagate the interrupt back up
1074           Thread.currentThread().interrupt();
1075         }
1076       }
1077     }
1078   }
1079 
1080   protected ThreadPoolExecutor getStoreOpenAndCloseThreadPool(
1081       final String threadNamePrefix) {
1082     int numStores = Math.max(1, this.htableDescriptor.getFamilies().size());
1083     int maxThreads = Math.min(numStores,
1084         conf.getInt(HConstants.HSTORE_OPEN_AND_CLOSE_THREADS_MAX,
1085             HConstants.DEFAULT_HSTORE_OPEN_AND_CLOSE_THREADS_MAX));
1086     return getOpenAndCloseThreadPool(maxThreads, threadNamePrefix);
1087   }
1088 
1089   protected ThreadPoolExecutor getStoreFileOpenAndCloseThreadPool(
1090       final String threadNamePrefix) {
1091     int numStores = Math.max(1, this.htableDescriptor.getFamilies().size());
1092     int maxThreads = Math.max(1,
1093         conf.getInt(HConstants.HSTORE_OPEN_AND_CLOSE_THREADS_MAX,
1094             HConstants.DEFAULT_HSTORE_OPEN_AND_CLOSE_THREADS_MAX)
1095             / numStores);
1096     return getOpenAndCloseThreadPool(maxThreads, threadNamePrefix);
1097   }
1098 
1099   static ThreadPoolExecutor getOpenAndCloseThreadPool(int maxThreads,
1100       final String threadNamePrefix) {
1101     return Threads.getBoundedCachedThreadPool(maxThreads, 30L, TimeUnit.SECONDS,
1102       new ThreadFactory() {
1103         private int count = 1;
1104 
1105         public Thread newThread(Runnable r) {
1106           return new Thread(r, threadNamePrefix + "-" + count++);
1107         }
1108       });
1109   }

1117   }

1264   /**
1265    * This is a helper function that compact all the stores synchronously
1266    * It is used by utilities and testing
1267    *
1268    * @throws IOException e
1269    */
1270   public void compactStores() throws IOException {
1271     for(Store s : getStores().values()) {
1272       CompactionRequest cr = s.requestCompaction();
1273       if(cr != null) {
1274         try {
1275           compact(cr);
1276         } finally {
1277           s.finishRequest(cr);
1278         }
1279       }
1280     }
1281   }

1283   /*
1284    * Called by compaction thread and after region is opened to compact the
1285    * HStores if necessary.
1286    *
1287    * <p>This operation could block for a long time, so don't call it from a
1288    * time-sensitive thread.
1289    *
1290    * Note that no locking is necessary at this level because compaction only
1291    * conflicts with a region split, and that cannot happen because the region
1292    * server does them sequentially and not in parallel.
1293    *
1294    * @param cr Compaction details, obtained by requestCompaction()
1295    * @return whether the compaction completed
1296    * @throws IOException e
1297    */
1298   public boolean compact(CompactionRequest cr)
1299   throws IOException {
1300     if (cr == null) {
1301       return false;
1302     }
1303     if (this.closing.get() || this.closed.get()) {
1304       LOG.debug("Skipping compaction on " + this + " because closing/closed");
1305       return false;
1306     }
1307     Preconditions.checkArgument(cr.getHRegion().equals(this));
1308     // block waiting for the lock for compaction
1309     lock.readLock().lock();
1310     MonitoredTask status = TaskMonitor.get().createStatus(
1311         "Compacting " + cr.getStore() + " in " + this);
1312     try {
1313       if (this.closed.get()) {
1314         LOG.debug("Skipping compaction on " + this + " because closed");
1315         return false;
1316       }
1317       boolean decr = true;
1318       try {
1319         synchronized (writestate) {
1320           if (writestate.writesEnabled) {
1321             ++writestate.compacting;
1322           } else {
1323             String msg = "NOT compacting region " + this + ". Writes disabled.";
1324             LOG.info(msg);
1325             status.abort(msg);
1326             decr = false;
1327             return false;
1328           }
1329         }
1330         LOG.info("Starting compaction on " + cr.getStore() + " in region "
1331             + this + (cr.getCompactSelection().isOffPeakCompaction()?" as an off-peak compaction":""));
1332         doRegionCompactionPrep();
1333         try {
1334           status.setStatus("Compacting store " + cr.getStore());
1335           cr.getStore().compact(cr);
1336         } catch (InterruptedIOException iioe) {
1337           String msg = "compaction interrupted";
1338           LOG.info(msg, iioe);
1339           status.abort(msg);
1340           return false;
1341         }
1342       } finally {
1343         if (decr) {
1344           synchronized (writestate) {
1345             --writestate.compacting;
1346             if (writestate.compacting <= 0) {
1347               writestate.notifyAll();
1348             }
1349           }
1350         }
1351       }
1352       status.markComplete("Compaction complete");
1353       return true;
1354     } finally {
1355       status.cleanup();
1356       lock.readLock().unlock();
1357     }
1358   }
1359 
1360   /**
1361    * Flush the cache.
1362    *
1363    * When this method is called the cache will be flushed unless:
1364    * <ol>
1365    *   <li>the cache is empty</li>
1366    *   <li>the region is closed.</li>
1367    *   <li>a flush is already in progress</li>
1368    *   <li>writes are disabled</li>
1369    * </ol>
1370    *
1371    * <p>This method may block for some time, so it should not be called from a
1372    * time-sensitive thread.
1373    *
1374    * @return true if cache was flushed
1375    *
1376    * @throws IOException general io exceptions
1377    * @throws DroppedSnapshotException Thrown when replay of hlog is required
1378    * because a Snapshot was not properly persisted.
1379    */
1380   public boolean flushcache() throws IOException {
1381     // fail-fast instead of waiting on the lock
1382     if (this.closing.get()) {
1383       LOG.debug("Skipping flush on " + this + " because closing");
1384       return false;
1385     }
1386     MonitoredTask status = TaskMonitor.get().createStatus("Flushing " + this);
1387     status.setStatus("Acquiring readlock on region");
1388     // block waiting for the lock for flushing cache
1389     lock.readLock().lock();
1390     try {
1391       if (this.closed.get()) {
1392         LOG.debug("Skipping flush on " + this + " because closed");
1393         status.abort("Skipped: closed");
1394         return false;
1395       }
1396       if (coprocessorHost != null) {
1397         status.setStatus("Running coprocessor pre-flush hooks");
1398         coprocessorHost.preFlush();
1399       }
1400       if (numPutsWithoutWAL.get() > 0) {
1401         numPutsWithoutWAL.set(0);
1402         dataInMemoryWithoutWAL.set(0);
1403       }
1404       synchronized (writestate) {
1405         if (!writestate.flushing && writestate.writesEnabled) {
1406           this.writestate.flushing = true;
1407         } else {
1408           if (LOG.isDebugEnabled()) {
1409             LOG.debug("NOT flushing memstore for region " + this
1410                 + ", flushing=" + writestate.flushing + ", writesEnabled="
1411                 + writestate.writesEnabled);
1412           }
1413           status.abort("Not flushing since "
1414               + (writestate.flushing ? "already flushing"
1415                   : "writes not enabled"));
1416           return false;
1417         }
1418       }
1419       try {
1420         boolean result = internalFlushcache(status);
1421 
1422         if (coprocessorHost != null) {
1423           status.setStatus("Running post-flush coprocessor hooks");
1424           coprocessorHost.postFlush();
1425         }
1426 
1427         status.markComplete("Flush successful");
1428         return result;
1429       } finally {
1430         synchronized (writestate) {
1431           writestate.flushing = false;
1432           this.writestate.flushRequested = false;
1433           writestate.notifyAll();
1434         }
1435       }
1436     } finally {
1437       lock.readLock().unlock();
1438       status.cleanup();
1439     }
1440   }
1441 
1442   /**
1443    * Flush the memstore.
1444    *
1445    * Flushing the memstore is a little tricky. We have a lot of updates in the
1446    * memstore, all of which have also been written to the log. We need to
1447    * write those updates in the memstore out to disk, while being able to
1448    * process reads/writes as much as possible during the flush operation. Also,
1449    * the log has to state clearly the point in time at which the memstore was
1450    * flushed. (That way, during recovery, we know when we can rely on the
1451    * on-disk flushed structures and when we have to recover the memstore from
1452    * the log.)
1453    *
1454    * <p>So, we have a three-step process:
1455    *
1456    * <ul><li>A. Flush the memstore to the on-disk stores, noting the current
1457    * sequence ID for the log.<li>
1458    *
1459    * <li>B. Write a FLUSHCACHE-COMPLETE message to the log, using the sequence
1460    * ID that was current at the time of memstore-flush.</li>
1461    *
1462    * <li>C. Get rid of the memstore structures that are now redundant, as
1463    * they've been flushed to the on-disk HStores.</li>
1464    * </ul>
1465    * <p>This method is protected, but can be accessed via several public
1466    * routes.
1467    *
1468    * <p> This method may block for some time.
1469    * @param status
1470    *
1471    * @return true if the region needs compacting
1472    *
1473    * @throws IOException general io exceptions
1474    * @throws DroppedSnapshotException Thrown when replay of hlog is required
1475    * because a Snapshot was not properly persisted.
1476    */
1477   protected boolean internalFlushcache(MonitoredTask status)
1478       throws IOException {
1479     return internalFlushcache(this.log, -1, status);
1480   }
1481 
1482   /**
1483    * @param wal Null if we're NOT to go via hlog/wal.
1484    * @param myseqid The seqid to use if <code>wal</code> is null writing out
1485    * flush file.
1486    * @param status
1487    * @return true if the region needs compacting
1488    * @throws IOException
1489    * @see #internalFlushcache(MonitoredTask)
1490    */
1491   protected boolean internalFlushcache(
1492       final HLog wal, final long myseqid, MonitoredTask status)
1493   throws IOException {
1494     if (this.rsServices != null && this.rsServices.isAborted()) {
1495       // Don't flush when server aborting, it's unsafe
1496       throw new IOException("Aborting flush because server is abortted...");
1497     }
1498     final long startTime = EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTimeMillis();
1499     // Clear flush flag.
1500     // Record latest flush time
1501     this.lastFlushTime = startTime;
1502     // If nothing to flush, return and avoid logging start/stop flush.
1503     if (this.memstoreSize.get() <= 0) {
1504       return false;
1505     }
1506     if (LOG.isDebugEnabled()) {
1507       LOG.debug("Started memstore flush for " + this +
1508         ", current region memstore size " +
1509         StringUtils.humanReadableInt(this.memstoreSize.get()) +
1510         ((wal != null)? "": "; wal is null, using passed sequenceid=" + myseqid));
1511     }
1512 
1513     // Stop updates while we snapshot the memstore of all stores. We only have
1514     // to do this for a moment.  Its quick.  The subsequent sequence id that
1515     // goes into the HLog after we've flushed all these snapshots also goes
1516     // into the info file that sits beside the flushed files.
1517     // We also set the memstore size to zero here before we allow updates
1518     // again so its value will represent the size of the updates received
1519     // during the flush
1520     long sequenceId = -1L;
1521     long completeSequenceId = -1L;
1522     MultiVersionConsistencyControl.WriteEntry w = null;
1523 
1524     // We have to take a write lock during snapshot, or else a write could
1525     // end up in both snapshot and memstore (makes it difficult to do atomic
1526     // rows then)
1527     status.setStatus("Obtaining lock to block concurrent updates");
1528     // block waiting for the lock for internal flush
1529     this.updatesLock.writeLock().lock();
1530     long flushsize = this.memstoreSize.get();
1531     status.setStatus("Preparing to flush by snapshotting stores");
1532     List<StoreFlusher> storeFlushers = new ArrayList<StoreFlusher>(stores.size());
1533     try {
1534       // Record the mvcc for all transactions in progress.
1535       w = mvcc.beginMemstoreInsert();
1536       mvcc.advanceMemstore(w);
1537 
1538       sequenceId = (wal == null)? myseqid:
1539         wal.startCacheFlush(this.regionInfo.getEncodedNameAsBytes());
1540       completeSequenceId = this.getCompleteCacheFlushSequenceId(sequenceId);
1541 
1542       for (Store s : stores.values()) {
1543         storeFlushers.add(s.getStoreFlusher(completeSequenceId));
1544       }
1545 
1546       // prepare flush (take a snapshot)
1547       for (StoreFlusher flusher : storeFlushers) {
1548         flusher.prepare();
1549       }
1550     } finally {
1551       this.updatesLock.writeLock().unlock();
1552     }
1553     String s = "Finished snapshotting " + this +
1554       ", commencing wait for mvcc, flushsize=" + flushsize;
1555     status.setStatus(s);
1556     LOG.debug(s);
1557 
1558     // wait for all in-progress transactions to commit to HLog before
1559     // we can start the flush. This prevents
1560     // uncommitted transactions from being written into HFiles.
1561     // We have to block before we start the flush, otherwise keys that
1562     // were removed via a rollbackMemstore could be written to Hfiles.
1563     mvcc.waitForRead(w);
1564 
1565     status.setStatus("Flushing stores");
1566     LOG.debug("Finished snapshotting, commencing flushing stores");
1567 
1568     // Any failure from here on out will be catastrophic requiring server
1569     // restart so hlog content can be replayed and put back into the memstore.
1570     // Otherwise, the snapshot content while backed up in the hlog, it will not
1571     // be part of the current running servers state.
1572     boolean compactionRequested = false;
1573     try {
1574       // A.  Flush memstore to all the HStores.
1575       // Keep running vector of all store files that includes both old and the
1576       // just-made new flush store file. The new flushed file is still in the
1577       // tmp directory.
1578 
1579       for (StoreFlusher flusher : storeFlushers) {
1580         flusher.flushCache(status);
1581       }
1582 
1583       // Switch snapshot (in memstore) -> new hfile (thus causing
1584       // all the store scanners to reset/reseek).
1585       for (StoreFlusher flusher : storeFlushers) {
1586         boolean needsCompaction = flusher.commit(status);
1587         if (needsCompaction) {
1588           compactionRequested = true;
1589         }
1590       }
1591       storeFlushers.clear();
1592 
1593       // Set down the memstore size by amount of flush.
1594       this.addAndGetGlobalMemstoreSize(-flushsize);
1595     } catch (Throwable t) {
1596       // An exception here means that the snapshot was not persisted.
1597       // The hlog needs to be replayed so its content is restored to memstore.
1598       // Currently, only a server restart will do this.
1599       // We used to only catch IOEs but its possible that we'd get other
1600       // exceptions -- e.g. HBASE-659 was about an NPE -- so now we catch
1601       // all and sundry.
1602       if (wal != null) {
1603         wal.abortCacheFlush(this.regionInfo.getEncodedNameAsBytes());
1604       }
1605       DroppedSnapshotException dse = new DroppedSnapshotException("region: " +
1606           Bytes.toStringBinary(getRegionName()));
1607       dse.initCause(t);
1608       status.abort("Flush failed: " + StringUtils.stringifyException(t));
1609       throw dse;
1610     }
1611 
1612     // If we get to here, the HStores have been written. If we get an
1613     // error in completeCacheFlush it will release the lock it is holding
1614 
1615     // B.  Write a FLUSHCACHE-COMPLETE message to the log.
1616     //     This tells future readers that the HStores were emitted correctly,
1617     //     and that all updates to the log for this regionName that have lower
1618     //     log-sequence-ids can be safely ignored.
1619     if (wal != null) {
1620       wal.completeCacheFlush(this.regionInfo.getEncodedNameAsBytes(),
1621         regionInfo.getTableName(), completeSequenceId,
1622         this.getRegionInfo().isMetaRegion());
1623     }
1624 
1625     // C. Finally notify anyone waiting on memstore to clear:
1626     // e.g. checkResources().
1627     synchronized (this) {
1628       notifyAll(); // FindBugs NN_NAKED_NOTIFY
1629     }
1630 
1631     long time = EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTimeMillis() - startTime;
1632     long memstoresize = this.memstoreSize.get();
1633     String msg = "Finished memstore flush of ~" +
1634       StringUtils.humanReadableInt(flushsize) + "/" + flushsize +
1635       ", currentsize=" +
1636       StringUtils.humanReadableInt(memstoresize) + "/" + memstoresize +
1637       " for region " + this + " in " + time + "ms, sequenceid=" + sequenceId +
1638       ", compaction requested=" + compactionRequested +
1639       ((wal == null)? "; wal=null": "");
1640     LOG.info(msg);
1641     status.setStatus(msg);
1642     this.recentFlushes.add(new Pair<Long,Long>(time/1000, flushsize));
1643 
1644     return compactionRequested;
1645   }

1651    *
1652    * @param currentSequenceId
1653    * @return sequence id to complete the cache flush with
1654    */
1655   protected long getCompleteCacheFlushSequenceId(long currentSequenceId) {
1656     return currentSequenceId;

1664    * or the one that immediately preceeds it, at or immediately before

1676   /**
1677    * Return all the data for the row that matches <i>row</i> exactly,
1678    * or the one that immediately preceeds it, at or immediately before
1679    * <i>ts</i>.
1680    *
1681    * @param row row key
1682    * @param family column family to find on
1683    * @return map of values
1684    * @throws IOException read exceptions
1685    */
1686   public Result getClosestRowBefore(final byte [] row, final byte [] family)
1687   throws IOException {
1688     if (coprocessorHost != null) {
1689       Result result = new Result();
1690       if (coprocessorHost.preGetClosestRowBefore(row, family, result)) {
1691         return result;
1692       }
1693     }
1694     // look across all the HStores for this region and determine what the
1695     // closest key is across all column families, since the data may be sparse
1696     checkRow(row, "getClosestRowBefore");
1697     startRegionOperation();
1698     this.readRequestsCount.increment();
1699     this.opMetrics.setReadRequestCountMetrics(this.readRequestsCount.get());   
1700     try {
1701       Store store = getStore(family);
1702       // get the closest key. (HStore.getRowKeyAtOrBefore can return null)
1703       KeyValue key = store.getRowKeyAtOrBefore(row);
1704       Result result = null;
1705       if (key != null) {
1706         Get get = new Get(key.getRow());
1707         get.addFamily(family);
1708         result = get(get, null);
1709       }
1710       if (coprocessorHost != null) {
1711         coprocessorHost.postGetClosestRowBefore(row, family, result);
1712       }
1713       return result;
1714     } finally {
1715       closeRegionOperation();
1716     }
1717   }

1720    * Return an iterator that scans over the HRegion, returning the indicated

1733   void prepareScanner(Scan scan) throws IOException {
1734     if(!scan.hasFamilies()) {
1735       // Adding all families to scanner
1736       for(byte[] family: this.htableDescriptor.getFamiliesKeys()){
1737         scan.addFamily(family);
1738       }
1739     }
1740   }

1742   protected RegionScanner getScanner(Scan scan,
1743       List<KeyValueScanner> additionalScanners) throws IOException {
1744     startRegionOperation();
1745     try {
1746       // Verify families are all valid
1747       prepareScanner(scan);
1748       if(scan.hasFamilies()) {
1749         for(byte [] family : scan.getFamilyMap().keySet()) {
1750           checkFamily(family);
1751         }
1752       }
1753       return instantiateRegionScanner(scan, additionalScanners);
1754     } finally {
1755       closeRegionOperation();
1756     }
1757   }

1760       List<KeyValueScanner> additionalScanners) throws IOException {
1761     return new RegionScannerImpl(scan, additionalScanners, this);

1764   /*
1765    * @param delete The passed delete is modified by this method. WARNING!
1766    */
1767   private void prepareDelete(Delete delete) throws IOException {
1768     // Check to see if this is a deleteRow insert
1769     if(delete.getFamilyMap().isEmpty()){
1770       for(byte [] family : this.htableDescriptor.getFamiliesKeys()){
1771         // Don't eat the timestamp
1772         delete.deleteFamily(family, delete.getTimeStamp());
1773       }
1774     } else {
1775       for(byte [] family : delete.getFamilyMap().keySet()) {
1776         if(family == null) {
1777           throw new NoSuchColumnFamilyException("Empty family is invalid");
1778         }
1779         checkFamily(family);
1780       }
1781     }
1782   }

1798   /**
1799    * @param delete delete object
1800    * @param lockid existing lock id, or null for grab a lock
1801    * @param writeToWAL append to the write ahead lock or not
1802    * @throws IOException read exceptions
1803    * @deprecated row locks (lockId) held outside the extent of the operation are deprecated.
1804    */
1805   public void delete(Delete delete, Integer lockid, boolean writeToWAL)
1806   throws IOException {
1807     checkReadOnly();
1808     checkResources();
1809     Integer lid = null;
1810     startRegionOperation();
1811     this.writeRequestsCount.increment();
1812     this.opMetrics.setWriteRequestCountMetrics(this.writeRequestsCount.get());
1813     try {
1814       byte [] row = delete.getRow();
1815       // If we did not pass an existing row lock, obtain a new one
1816       lid = getLock(lockid, row, true);
1817 
1818       try {
1819         // All edits for the given row (across all column families) must happen atomically.
1820         prepareDelete(delete);
1821         internalDelete(delete, delete.getClusterId(), writeToWAL);
1822       } finally {
1823         if(lockid == null) releaseRowLock(lid);
1824       }
1825     } finally {
1826       closeRegionOperation();
1827     }
1828   }

1830   /**
1831    * This is used only by unit tests. Not required to be a public API.
1832    * @param familyMap map of family to edits for the given family.
1833    * @param writeToWAL
1834    * @throws IOException
1835    */
1836   void delete(Map<byte[], List<KeyValue>> familyMap, UUID clusterId,
1837       boolean writeToWAL) throws IOException {
1838     Delete delete = new Delete();
1839     delete.setFamilyMap(familyMap);
1840     delete.setClusterId(clusterId);
1841     delete.setWriteToWAL(writeToWAL);
1842     internalDelete(delete, clusterId, writeToWAL);
1843   }

1845   /**
1846    * Setup correct timestamps in the KVs in Delete object.
1847    * Caller should have the row and region locks.
1848    * @param familyMap
1849    * @param now
1850    * @throws IOException
1851    */
1852   private void prepareDeleteTimestamps(Map<byte[], List<KeyValue>> familyMap, byte[] byteNow)
1853       throws IOException {
1854     for (Map.Entry<byte[], List<KeyValue>> e : familyMap.entrySet()) {
1855 
1856       byte[] family = e.getKey();
1857       List<KeyValue> kvs = e.getValue();
1858       Map<byte[], Integer> kvCount = new TreeMap<byte[], Integer>(Bytes.BYTES_COMPARATOR);
1859 
1860       for (KeyValue kv: kvs) {
1861         //  Check if time is LATEST, change to time of most recent addition if so
1862         //  This is expensive.
1863         if (kv.isLatestTimestamp() && kv.isDeleteType()) {
1864           byte[] qual = kv.getQualifier();
1865           if (qual == null) qual = HConstants.EMPTY_BYTE_ARRAY;
1866 
1867           Integer count = kvCount.get(qual);
1868           if (count == null) {
1869             kvCount.put(qual, 1);
1870           } else {
1871             kvCount.put(qual, count + 1);
1872           }
1873           count = kvCount.get(qual);
1874 
1875           Get get = new Get(kv.getRow());
1876           get.setMaxVersions(count);
1877           get.addColumn(family, qual);
1878 
1879           List<KeyValue> result = get(get, false);
1880 
1881           if (result.size() < count) {
1882             // Nothing to delete
1883             kv.updateLatestStamp(byteNow);
1884             continue;
1885           }
1886           if (result.size() > count) {
1887             throw new RuntimeException("Unexpected size: " + result.size());
1888           }
1889           KeyValue getkv = result.get(count - 1);
1890           Bytes.putBytes(kv.getBuffer(), kv.getTimestampOffset(),
1891               getkv.getBuffer(), getkv.getTimestampOffset(), Bytes.SIZEOF_LONG);
1892         } else {
1893           kv.updateLatestStamp(byteNow);
1894         }
1895       }
1896     }
1897   }

1899   /**
1900    * @param delete The Delete command
1901    * @param clusterId UUID of the originating cluster (for replication).
1902    * @param writeToWAL
1903    * @throws IOException
1904    */
1905   private void internalDelete(Delete delete, UUID clusterId,
1906       boolean writeToWAL) throws IOException {
1907     Map<byte[], List<KeyValue>> familyMap = delete.getFamilyMap();
1908     WALEdit walEdit = new WALEdit();
1909     /* Run coprocessor pre hook outside of locks to avoid deadlock */
1910     if (coprocessorHost != null) {
1911       if (coprocessorHost.preDelete(delete, walEdit, writeToWAL)) {
1912         return;
1913       }
1914     }
1915 
1916     long now = EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTimeMillis();
1917     byte [] byteNow = Bytes.toBytes(now);
1918     boolean flush = false;
1919 
1920     lock(updatesLock.readLock());
1921     try {
1922       prepareDeleteTimestamps(delete.getFamilyMap(), byteNow);
1923 
1924       if (writeToWAL) {
1925         // write/sync to WAL should happen before we touch memstore.
1926         //
1927         // If order is reversed, i.e. we write to memstore first, and
1928         // for some reason fail to write/sync to commit log, the memstore
1929         // will contain uncommitted transactions.
1930         //
1931         // bunch up all edits across all column families into a
1932         // single WALEdit.
1933         addFamilyMapToWALEdit(familyMap, walEdit);
1934         this.log.append(regionInfo, this.htableDescriptor.getName(),
1935             walEdit, clusterId, now, this.htableDescriptor);
1936       }
1937 
1938       // Now make changes to the memstore.
1939       long addedSize = applyFamilyMapToMemstore(familyMap, null);
1940       flush = isFlushSize(this.addAndGetGlobalMemstoreSize(addedSize));
1941 
1942     } finally {
1943       this.updatesLock.readLock().unlock();
1944     }
1945     // do after lock
1946     if (coprocessorHost != null) {
1947       coprocessorHost.postDelete(delete, walEdit, writeToWAL);
1948     }
1949     final long after = EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTimeMillis();
1950     this.opMetrics.updateDeleteMetrics(familyMap.keySet(), after-now);
1951 
1952     if (flush) {
1953       // Request a cache flush.  Do it outside update lock.
1954       requestFlush();
1955     }
1956   }

1960    * @throws IOException
1961    */

1963     this.put(put, null, put.getWriteToWAL());

1987   /**
1988    * @param put
1989    * @param lockid
1990    * @param writeToWAL
1991    * @throws IOException
1992    * @deprecated row locks (lockId) held outside the extent of the operation are deprecated.
1993    */
1994   public void put(Put put, Integer lockid, boolean writeToWAL)
1995   throws IOException {
1996     checkReadOnly();
1997 
1998     // Do a rough check that we have resources to accept a write.  The check is
1999     // 'rough' in that between the resource check and the call to obtain a
2000     // read lock, resources may run out.  For now, the thought is that this
2001     // will be extremely rare; we'll deal with it when it happens.
2002     checkResources();
2003     startRegionOperation();
2004     this.writeRequestsCount.increment();
2005     this.opMetrics.setWriteRequestCountMetrics(this.writeRequestsCount.get());
2006     try {
2007       // We obtain a per-row lock, so other clients will block while one client
2008       // performs an update. The read lock is released by the client calling
2009       // #commit or #abort or if the HRegionServer lease on the lock expires.
2010       // See HRegionServer#RegionListener for how the expire on HRegionServer
2011       // invokes a HRegion#abort.
2012       byte [] row = put.getRow();
2013       // If we did not pass an existing row lock, obtain a new one
2014       Integer lid = getLock(lockid, row, true);
2015 
2016       try {
2017         // All edits for the given row (across all column families) must happen atomically.
2018         internalPut(put, put.getClusterId(), writeToWAL);
2019       } finally {
2020         if(lockid == null) releaseRowLock(lid);
2021       }
2022     } finally {
2023       closeRegionOperation();
2024     }
2025   }
