2027   /**
2028    * Struct-like class that tracks the progress of a batch operation,
2029    * accumulating status codes and tracking the index at which processing
2030    * is proceeding.
2031    */
2032   private static class BatchOperationInProgress<T> {
2033     T[] operations;
2034     int nextIndexToProcess = 0;
2035     OperationStatus[] retCodeDetails;
2036     WALEdit[] walEditsFromCoprocessors;
2037 
2038     public BatchOperationInProgress(T[] operations) {
2039       this.operations = operations;
2040       this.retCodeDetails = new OperationStatus[operations.length];
2041       this.walEditsFromCoprocessors = new WALEdit[operations.length];
2042       Arrays.fill(this.retCodeDetails, OperationStatus.NOT_RUN);
2043     }
2044 
2045     public boolean isDone() {
2046       return nextIndexToProcess == operations.length;
2047     }
2048   }
2049 
2050   /**
2051    * Perform a batch put with no pre-specified locks
2052    * @see HRegion#batchMutate(Pair[])
2053    */
2054   public OperationStatus[] put(Put[] puts) throws IOException {
2055     @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
2056     Pair<Mutation, Integer> putsAndLocks[] = new Pair[puts.length];
2057 
2058     for (int i = 0; i < puts.length; i++) {
2059       putsAndLocks[i] = new Pair<Mutation, Integer>(puts[i], null);
2060     }
2061     return batchMutate(putsAndLocks);
2062   }
2063 
2064   /**
2065    * Perform a batch of puts.
2066    * @param putsAndLocks
2067    *          the list of puts paired with their requested lock IDs.
2068    * @return an array of OperationStatus which internally contains the OperationStatusCode and the
2069    *         exceptionMessage if any.
2070    * @throws IOException
2071    * @deprecated Instead use {@link HRegion#batchMutate(Pair[])}
2072    */
2073   @Deprecated
2074   public OperationStatus[] put(Pair<Put, Integer>[] putsAndLocks) throws IOException {
2075     Pair<Mutation, Integer>[] mutationsAndLocks = new Pair[putsAndLocks.length];
2076     System.arraycopy(putsAndLocks, 0, mutationsAndLocks, 0, putsAndLocks.length);
2077     return batchMutate(mutationsAndLocks);
2078   }
2079 
2080   /**
2081    * Perform a batch of mutations.
2082    * It supports only Put and Delete mutations and will ignore other types passed.
2083    * @param mutationsAndLocks
2084    *          the list of mutations paired with their requested lock IDs.
2085    * @return an array of OperationStatus which internally contains the
2086    *         OperationStatusCode and the exceptionMessage if any.
2087    * @throws IOException
2088    */
2089   public OperationStatus[] batchMutate(
2090       Pair<Mutation, Integer>[] mutationsAndLocks) throws IOException {
2091     BatchOperationInProgress<Pair<Mutation, Integer>> batchOp =
2092       new BatchOperationInProgress<Pair<Mutation,Integer>>(mutationsAndLocks);
2093 
2094     boolean initialized = false;
2095 
2096     while (!batchOp.isDone()) {
2097       checkReadOnly();
2098       checkResources();
2099 
2100       long newSize;
2101       startRegionOperation();
2102 
2103       try {
2104         if (!initialized) {
2105           this.writeRequestsCount.increment();
2106           this.opMetrics.setWriteRequestCountMetrics(this.writeRequestsCount.get());
2107           doPreMutationHook(batchOp);
2108           initialized = true;
2109         }
2110         long addedSize = doMiniBatchMutation(batchOp);
2111         newSize = this.addAndGetGlobalMemstoreSize(addedSize);
2112       } finally {
2113         closeRegionOperation();
2114       }
2115       if (isFlushSize(newSize)) {
2116         requestFlush();
2117       }
2118     }
2119     return batchOp.retCodeDetails;
2120   }
2121 
2122   private void doPreMutationHook(BatchOperationInProgress<Pair<Mutation, Integer>> batchOp)
2123       throws IOException {
2124     /* Run coprocessor pre hook outside of locks to avoid deadlock */
2125     WALEdit walEdit = new WALEdit();
2126     if (coprocessorHost != null) {
2127       for (int i = 0; i < batchOp.operations.length; i++) {
2128         Pair<Mutation, Integer> nextPair = batchOp.operations[i];
2129         Mutation m = nextPair.getFirst();
2130         if (m instanceof Put) {
2131           if (coprocessorHost.prePut((Put) m, walEdit, m.getWriteToWAL())) {
2132             // pre hook says skip this Put
2133             // mark as success and skip in doMiniBatchMutation
2134             batchOp.retCodeDetails[i] = OperationStatus.SUCCESS;
2135           }
2136         } else if (m instanceof Delete) {
2137           if (coprocessorHost.preDelete((Delete) m, walEdit, m.getWriteToWAL())) {
2138             // pre hook says skip this Delete
2139             // mark as success and skip in doMiniBatchMutation
2140             batchOp.retCodeDetails[i] = OperationStatus.SUCCESS;
2141           }
2142         } else {
2143           // In case of passing Append mutations along with the Puts and Deletes in batchMutate
2144           // mark the operation return code as failure so that it will not be considered in
2145           // the doMiniBatchMutation
2146           batchOp.retCodeDetails[i] = new OperationStatus(OperationStatusCode.FAILURE,
2147               "Put/Delete mutations only supported in batchMutate() now");
2148         }
2149         if (!walEdit.isEmpty()) {
2150           batchOp.walEditsFromCoprocessors[i] = walEdit;
2151           walEdit = new WALEdit();
2152         }
2153       }
2154     }
2155   }
2156 
2157   // The mutation will be either a Put or Delete.
2158   @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
2159   private long doMiniBatchMutation(
2160       BatchOperationInProgress<Pair<Mutation, Integer>> batchOp) throws IOException {
2161 
2162     // The set of columnFamilies first seen for Put.
2163     Set<byte[]> putsCfSet = null;
2164     // variable to note if all Put items are for the same CF -- metrics related
2165     boolean putsCfSetConsistent = true;
2166     // The set of columnFamilies first seen for Delete.
2167     Set<byte[]> deletesCfSet = null;
2168     // variable to note if all Delete items are for the same CF -- metrics related
2169     boolean deletesCfSetConsistent = true;
2170     long startTimeMs = EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTimeMillis();
2171 
2172     WALEdit walEdit = new WALEdit();
2173 
2174     MultiVersionConsistencyControl.WriteEntry w = null;
2175     long txid = 0;
2176     boolean walSyncSuccessful = false;
2177     boolean locked = false;
2178 
2179     /** Keep track of the locks we hold so we can release them in finally clause */
2180     List<Integer> acquiredLocks = Lists.newArrayListWithCapacity(batchOp.operations.length);
2181     // reference family maps directly so coprocessors can mutate them if desired
2182     Map<byte[],List<KeyValue>>[] familyMaps = new Map[batchOp.operations.length];
2183     // We try to set up a batch in the range [firstIndex,lastIndexExclusive)
2184     int firstIndex = batchOp.nextIndexToProcess;
2185     int lastIndexExclusive = firstIndex;
2186     boolean success = false;
2187     int noOfPuts = 0, noOfDeletes = 0;
2188     try {
2189       // ------------------------------------
2190       // STEP 1. Try to acquire as many locks as we can, and ensure
2191       // we acquire at least one.
2192       // ----------------------------------
2193       int numReadyToWrite = 0;
2194       long now = EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTimeMillis();
2195       while (lastIndexExclusive < batchOp.operations.length) {
2196         Pair<Mutation, Integer> nextPair = batchOp.operations[lastIndexExclusive];
2197         Mutation mutation = nextPair.getFirst();
2198         Integer providedLockId = nextPair.getSecond();
2199 
2200         Map<byte[], List<KeyValue>> familyMap = mutation.getFamilyMap();
2201         // store the family map reference to allow for mutations
2202         familyMaps[lastIndexExclusive] = familyMap;
2203 
2204         // skip anything that "ran" already
2205         if (batchOp.retCodeDetails[lastIndexExclusive].getOperationStatusCode()
2206             != OperationStatusCode.NOT_RUN) {
2207           lastIndexExclusive++;
2208           continue;
2209         }
2210 
2211         try {
2212           if (mutation instanceof Put) {
2213             checkFamilies(familyMap.keySet());
2214             checkTimestamps(mutation.getFamilyMap(), now);
2215           } else {
2216             prepareDelete((Delete) mutation);
2217           }
2218         } catch (NoSuchColumnFamilyException nscf) {
2219           LOG.warn("No such column family in batch mutation", nscf);
2220           batchOp.retCodeDetails[lastIndexExclusive] = new OperationStatus(
2221               OperationStatusCode.BAD_FAMILY, nscf.getMessage());
2222           lastIndexExclusive++;
2223           continue;
2224         } catch (DoNotRetryIOException fsce) {
2225           // The only thing that throws a generic DoNotRetryIOException in the above code is
2226           // checkTimestamps so that DoNotRetryIOException means that timestamps were invalid.
2227           // If more checks are added, be sure to revisit this assumption.
2228           LOG.warn("Batch Mutation did not pass sanity check", fsce);
2229           batchOp.retCodeDetails[lastIndexExclusive] = new OperationStatus(
2230               OperationStatusCode.SANITY_CHECK_FAILURE, fsce.getMessage());
2231           lastIndexExclusive++;
2232           continue;
2233         }
2234         // If we haven't got any rows in our batch, we should block to
2235         // get the next one.
2236         boolean shouldBlock = numReadyToWrite == 0;
2237         Integer acquiredLockId = null;
2238         try {
2239           acquiredLockId = getLock(providedLockId, mutation.getRow(),
2240               shouldBlock);
2241         } catch (IOException ioe) {
2242           LOG.warn("Failed getting lock in batch put, row="
2243                   + Bytes.toStringBinary(mutation.getRow()), ioe);
2244         }
2245         if (acquiredLockId == null) {
2246           // We failed to grab another lock
2247           assert !shouldBlock : "Should never fail to get lock when blocking";
2248           break; // stop acquiring more rows for this batch
2249         }
2250         if (providedLockId == null) {
2251           acquiredLocks.add(acquiredLockId);
2252         }
2253         lastIndexExclusive++;
2254         numReadyToWrite++;
2255 
2256         if (mutation instanceof Put) {
2257           // If Column Families stay consistent through out all of the
2258           // individual puts then metrics can be reported as a mutliput across
2259           // column families in the first put.
2260           if (putsCfSet == null) {
2261             putsCfSet = mutation.getFamilyMap().keySet();
2262           } else {
2263             putsCfSetConsistent = putsCfSetConsistent
2264                 && mutation.getFamilyMap().keySet().equals(putsCfSet);
2265           }
2266         } else {
2267           if (deletesCfSet == null) {
2268             deletesCfSet = mutation.getFamilyMap().keySet();
2269           } else {
2270             deletesCfSetConsistent = deletesCfSetConsistent
2271                 && mutation.getFamilyMap().keySet().equals(deletesCfSet);
2272           }
2273         }
2274       }
2275 
2276       // we should record the timestamp only after we have acquired the rowLock,
2277       // otherwise, newer puts/deletes are not guaranteed to have a newer timestamp
2278       now = EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTimeMillis();
2279       byte[] byteNow = Bytes.toBytes(now);
2280 
2281       // Nothing to put/delete -- an exception in the above such as NoSuchColumnFamily?
2282       if (numReadyToWrite <= 0) return 0L;
2283 
2284       // We've now grabbed as many mutations off the list as we can
2285 
2286       // ------------------------------------
2287       // STEP 2. Update any LATEST_TIMESTAMP timestamps
2288       // ----------------------------------
2289       for (int i = firstIndex; i < lastIndexExclusive; i++) {
2290         // skip invalid
2291         if (batchOp.retCodeDetails[i].getOperationStatusCode()
2292             != OperationStatusCode.NOT_RUN) continue;
2293         Mutation mutation = batchOp.operations[i].getFirst();
2294         if (mutation instanceof Put) {
2295           updateKVTimestamps(familyMaps[i].values(), byteNow);
2296           noOfPuts++;
2297         } else {
2298           prepareDeleteTimestamps(familyMaps[i], byteNow);
2299           noOfDeletes++;
2300         }
2301       }
2302 
2303       lock(this.updatesLock.readLock(), numReadyToWrite);
2304       locked = true;
2305 
2306       //
2307       // ------------------------------------
2308       // Acquire the latest mvcc number
2309       // ----------------------------------
2310       w = mvcc.beginMemstoreInsert();
2311 
2312       // calling the pre CP hook for batch mutation
2313       if (coprocessorHost != null) {
2314         MiniBatchOperationInProgress<Pair<Mutation, Integer>> miniBatchOp = 
2315           new MiniBatchOperationInProgress<Pair<Mutation, Integer>>(batchOp.operations, 
2316           batchOp.retCodeDetails, batchOp.walEditsFromCoprocessors, firstIndex, lastIndexExclusive);
2317         if (coprocessorHost.preBatchMutate(miniBatchOp)) return 0L;
2318       }
2319 
2320       // ------------------------------------
2321       // STEP 3. Write back to memstore
2322       // Write to memstore. It is ok to write to memstore
2323       // first without updating the HLog because we do not roll
2324       // forward the memstore MVCC. The MVCC will be moved up when
2325       // the complete operation is done. These changes are not yet
2326       // visible to scanners till we update the MVCC. The MVCC is
2327       // moved only when the sync is complete.
2328       // ----------------------------------
2329       long addedSize = 0;
2330       for (int i = firstIndex; i < lastIndexExclusive; i++) {
2331         if (batchOp.retCodeDetails[i].getOperationStatusCode()
2332             != OperationStatusCode.NOT_RUN) {
2333           continue;
2334         }
2335         addedSize += applyFamilyMapToMemstore(familyMaps[i], w);
2336       }
2337 
2338       // ------------------------------------
2339       // STEP 4. Build WAL edit
2340       // ----------------------------------
2341       for (int i = firstIndex; i < lastIndexExclusive; i++) {
2342         // Skip puts that were determined to be invalid during preprocessing
2343         if (batchOp.retCodeDetails[i].getOperationStatusCode()
2344             != OperationStatusCode.NOT_RUN) {
2345           continue;
2346         }
2347         batchOp.retCodeDetails[i] = OperationStatus.SUCCESS;
2348 
2349         Mutation m = batchOp.operations[i].getFirst();
2350         if (!m.getWriteToWAL()) {
2351           if (m instanceof Put) {
2352             recordPutWithoutWal(m.getFamilyMap());
2353           }
2354           continue;
2355         }
2356         // Add WAL edits by CP
2357         WALEdit fromCP = batchOp.walEditsFromCoprocessors[i];
2358         if (fromCP != null) {
2359           for (KeyValue kv : fromCP.getKeyValues()) {
2360             walEdit.add(kv);
2361           }
2362         }
2363         addFamilyMapToWALEdit(familyMaps[i], walEdit);
2364       }
2365 
2366       // -------------------------
2367       // STEP 5. Append the edit to WAL. Do not sync wal.
2368       // -------------------------
2369       Mutation first = batchOp.operations[firstIndex].getFirst();
2370       txid = this.log.appendNoSync(regionInfo, this.htableDescriptor.getName(),
2371                walEdit, first.getClusterId(), now, this.htableDescriptor);
2372 
2373       // -------------------------------
2374       // STEP 6. Release row locks, etc.
2375       // -------------------------------
2376       if (locked) {
2377         this.updatesLock.readLock().unlock();
2378         locked = false;
2379       }
2380       if (acquiredLocks != null) {
2381         for (Integer toRelease : acquiredLocks) {
2382           releaseRowLock(toRelease);
2383         }
2384         acquiredLocks = null;
2385       }
2386       // -------------------------
2387       // STEP 7. Sync wal.
2388       // -------------------------
2389       if (walEdit.size() > 0) {
2390         syncOrDefer(txid);
2391       }
2392       walSyncSuccessful = true;
2393       // calling the post CP hook for batch mutation
2394       if (coprocessorHost != null) {
2395         MiniBatchOperationInProgress<Pair<Mutation, Integer>> miniBatchOp = 
2396           new MiniBatchOperationInProgress<Pair<Mutation, Integer>>(batchOp.operations, 
2397           batchOp.retCodeDetails, batchOp.walEditsFromCoprocessors, firstIndex, lastIndexExclusive);
2398         coprocessorHost.postBatchMutate(miniBatchOp);
2399       }
2400       
2401       // ------------------------------------------------------------------
2402       // STEP 8. Advance mvcc. This will make this put visible to scanners and getters.
2403       // ------------------------------------------------------------------
2404       if (w != null) {
2405         mvcc.completeMemstoreInsert(w);
2406         w = null;
2407       }
2408 
2409       // ------------------------------------
2410       // STEP 9. Run coprocessor post hooks. This should be done after the wal is
2411       // synced so that the coprocessor contract is adhered to.
2412       // ------------------------------------
2413       if (coprocessorHost != null) {
2414         for (int i = firstIndex; i < lastIndexExclusive; i++) {
2415           // only for successful puts
2416           if (batchOp.retCodeDetails[i].getOperationStatusCode()
2417               != OperationStatusCode.SUCCESS) {
2418             continue;
2419           }
2420           Mutation m = batchOp.operations[i].getFirst();
2421           if (m instanceof Put) {
2422             coprocessorHost.postPut((Put) m, walEdit, m.getWriteToWAL());
2423           } else {
2424             coprocessorHost.postDelete((Delete) m, walEdit, m.getWriteToWAL());
2425           }
2426         }
2427       }
2428       success = true;
2429       return addedSize;
2430     } finally {
2431 
2432       // if the wal sync was unsuccessful, remove keys from memstore
2433       if (!walSyncSuccessful) {
2434         rollbackMemstore(batchOp, familyMaps, firstIndex, lastIndexExclusive);
2435       }
2436       if (w != null) mvcc.completeMemstoreInsert(w);
2437 
2438       if (locked) {
2439         this.updatesLock.readLock().unlock();
2440       }
2441 
2442       if (acquiredLocks != null) {
2443         for (Integer toRelease : acquiredLocks) {
2444           releaseRowLock(toRelease);
2445         }
2446       }
2447 
2448       // do after lock
2449       final long netTimeMs = EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTimeMillis()- startTimeMs;
2450 
2451       // See if the column families were consistent through the whole thing.
2452       // if they were then keep them. If they were not then pass a null.
2453       // null will be treated as unknown.
2454       // Total time taken might be involving Puts and Deletes.
2455       // Split the time for puts and deletes based on the total number of Puts and Deletes.
2456       long timeTakenForPuts = 0;
2457       if (noOfPuts > 0) {
2458         // There were some Puts in the batch.
2459         double noOfMutations = noOfPuts + noOfDeletes;
2460         timeTakenForPuts = (long) (netTimeMs * (noOfPuts / noOfMutations));
2461         final Set<byte[]> keptCfs = putsCfSetConsistent ? putsCfSet : null;
2462         this.opMetrics.updateMultiPutMetrics(keptCfs, timeTakenForPuts);
2463       }
2464       if (noOfDeletes > 0) {
2465         // There were some Deletes in the batch.
2466         final Set<byte[]> keptCfs = deletesCfSetConsistent ? deletesCfSet : null;
2467         this.opMetrics.updateMultiDeleteMetrics(keptCfs, netTimeMs - timeTakenForPuts);
2468       }
2469       if (!success) {
2470         for (int i = firstIndex; i < lastIndexExclusive; i++) {
2471           if (batchOp.retCodeDetails[i].getOperationStatusCode() == OperationStatusCode.NOT_RUN) {
2472             batchOp.retCodeDetails[i] = OperationStatus.FAILURE;
2473           }
2474         }
2475       }
2476       batchOp.nextIndexToProcess = lastIndexExclusive;
2477     }
2478   }
2479 
2480   //TODO, Think that gets/puts and deletes should be refactored a bit so that
2481   //the getting of the lock happens before, so that you would just pass it into
2482   //the methods. So in the case of checkAndMutate you could just do lockRow,
2483   //get, put, unlockRow or something
2484  /**
2485   *
2486   * @param row
2487   * @param family
2488   * @param qualifier
2489   * @param compareOp
2490   * @param comparator
2491   * @param writeToWAL
2492   * @throws IOException
2493   * @return true if the new put was execute, false otherwise
2494   */
2495  public boolean checkAndMutate(byte [] row, byte [] family, byte [] qualifier,
2496      CompareOp compareOp, WritableByteArrayComparable comparator, Writable w,
2497      boolean writeToWAL)
2498  throws IOException {
2499    return checkAndMutate(row, family, qualifier, compareOp, comparator, w, null, writeToWAL);
2500  }
2501   
2502   /**
2503    *
2504    * @param row
2505    * @param family
2506    * @param qualifier
2507    * @param compareOp
2508    * @param comparator
2509    * @param lockId
2510    * @param writeToWAL
2511    * @throws IOException
2512    * @return true if the new put was execute, false otherwise
2513    * @deprecated row locks (lockId) held outside the extent of the operation are deprecated.
2514    */
2515   public boolean checkAndMutate(byte [] row, byte [] family, byte [] qualifier,
2516       CompareOp compareOp, WritableByteArrayComparable comparator, Writable w,
2517       Integer lockId, boolean writeToWAL)
2518   throws IOException{
2519     checkReadOnly();
2520     //TODO, add check for value length or maybe even better move this to the
2521     //client if this becomes a global setting
2522     checkResources();
2523     boolean isPut = w instanceof Put;
2524     if (!isPut && !(w instanceof Delete))
2525       throw new DoNotRetryIOException("Action must be Put or Delete");
2526     Row r = (Row)w;
2527     if (!Bytes.equals(row, r.getRow())) {
2528       throw new DoNotRetryIOException("Action's getRow must match the passed row");
2529     }
2530 
2531     startRegionOperation();
2532     this.writeRequestsCount.increment();
2533     this.opMetrics.setWriteRequestCountMetrics(this.writeRequestsCount.get());
2534     try {
2535       RowLock lock = isPut ? ((Put)w).getRowLock() : ((Delete)w).getRowLock();
2536       Get get = new Get(row, lock);
2537       checkFamily(family);
2538       get.addColumn(family, qualifier);
2539 
2540       // Lock row
2541       Integer lid = getLock(lockId, get.getRow(), true);
2542       // wait for all previous transactions to complete (with lock held)
2543       mvcc.completeMemstoreInsert(mvcc.beginMemstoreInsert());
2544       List<KeyValue> result = new ArrayList<KeyValue>();
2545       try {
2546         result = get(get, false);
2547 
2548         boolean valueIsNull = comparator.getValue() == null ||
2549           comparator.getValue().length == 0;
2550         boolean matches = false;
2551         if (result.size() == 0 && valueIsNull) {
2552           matches = true;
2553         } else if (result.size() > 0 && result.get(0).getValue().length == 0 &&
2554             valueIsNull) {
2555           matches = true;
2556         } else if (result.size() == 1 && !valueIsNull) {
2557           KeyValue kv = result.get(0);
2558           int compareResult = comparator.compareTo(kv.getBuffer(),
2559               kv.getValueOffset(), kv.getValueLength());
2560           switch (compareOp) {
2561           case LESS:
2562             matches = compareResult <= 0;
2563             break;
2564           case LESS_OR_EQUAL:
2565             matches = compareResult < 0;
2566             break;
2567           case EQUAL:
2568             matches = compareResult == 0;
2569             break;
2570           case NOT_EQUAL:
2571             matches = compareResult != 0;
2572             break;
2573           case GREATER_OR_EQUAL:
2574             matches = compareResult > 0;
2575             break;
2576           case GREATER:
2577             matches = compareResult >= 0;
2578             break;
2579           default:
2580             throw new RuntimeException("Unknown Compare op " + compareOp.name());
2581           }
2582         }
2583         //If matches put the new put or delete the new delete
2584         if (matches) {
2585           // All edits for the given row (across all column families) must
2586           // happen atomically.
2587           //
2588           // Using default cluster id, as this can only happen in the
2589           // originating cluster. A slave cluster receives the result as a Put
2590           // or Delete
2591           if (isPut) {
2592             internalPut(((Put) w), HConstants.DEFAULT_CLUSTER_ID, writeToWAL);
2593           } else {
2594             Delete d = (Delete)w;
2595             prepareDelete(d);
2596             internalDelete(d, HConstants.DEFAULT_CLUSTER_ID, writeToWAL);
2597           }
2598           return true;
2599         }
2600         return false;
2601       } finally {
2602         if(lockId == null) releaseRowLock(lid);
2603       }
2604     } finally {
2605       closeRegionOperation();
2606     }
2607   }

2610   /**
2611    * Complete taking the snapshot on the region. Writes the region info and adds references to the
2612    * working snapshot directory.
2613    *
2614    * TODO for api consistency, consider adding another version with no {@link ForeignExceptionSnare}
2615    * arg.  (In the future other cancellable HRegion methods could eventually add a
2616    * {@link ForeignExceptionSnare}, or we could do something fancier).
2617    *
2618    * @param desc snasphot description object
2619    * @param exnSnare ForeignExceptionSnare that captures external exeptions in case we need to
2620    *   bail out.  This is allowed to be null and will just be ignored in that case.
2621    * @throws IOException if there is an external or internal error causing the snapshot to fail
2622    */
2623   public void addRegionToSnapshot(SnapshotDescription desc,
2624       ForeignExceptionSnare exnSnare) throws IOException {
2625     // This should be "fast" since we don't rewrite store files but instead
2626     // back up the store files by creating a reference
2627     Path rootDir = FSUtils.getRootDir(this.rsServices.getConfiguration());
2628     Path snapshotRegionDir = TakeSnapshotUtils.getRegionSnapshotDirectory(desc, rootDir,
2629       regionInfo.getEncodedName());
2630 
2631     // 1. dump region meta info into the snapshot directory
2632     LOG.debug("Storing region-info for snapshot.");
2633     checkRegioninfoOnFilesystem(snapshotRegionDir);
2634 
2635     // 2. iterate through all the stores in the region
2636     LOG.debug("Creating references for hfiles");
2637 
2638     // This ensures that we have an atomic view of the directory as long as we have < ls limit
2639     // (batch size of the files in a directory) on the namenode. Otherwise, we get back the files in
2640     // batches and may miss files being added/deleted. This could be more robust (iteratively
2641     // checking to see if we have all the files until we are sure), but the limit is currently 1000
2642     // files/batch, far more than the number of store files under a single column family.
2643     for (Store store : stores.values()) {
2644       // 2.1. build the snapshot reference directory for the store
2645       Path dstStoreDir = TakeSnapshotUtils.getStoreSnapshotDirectory(snapshotRegionDir,
2646         Bytes.toString(store.getFamily().getName()));
2647       List<StoreFile> storeFiles = store.getStorefiles();
2648       if (LOG.isDebugEnabled()) {
2649         LOG.debug("Adding snapshot references for " + storeFiles  + " hfiles");
2650       }
2651 
2652       // 2.2. iterate through all the store's files and create "references".
2653       int sz = storeFiles.size();
2654       for (int i = 0; i < sz; i++) {
2655         if (exnSnare != null) {
2656           exnSnare.rethrowException();
2657         }
2658         Path file = storeFiles.get(i).getPath();
2659         // create "reference" to this store file.  It is intentionally an empty file -- all
2660         // necessary infomration is captured by its fs location and filename.  This allows us to
2661         // only figure out what needs to be done via a single nn operation (instead of having to
2662         // open and read the files as well).
2663         LOG.debug("Creating reference for file (" + (i+1) + "/" + sz + ") : " + file);
2664         Path referenceFile = new Path(dstStoreDir, file.getName());
2665         boolean success = HBaseFileSystem.createNewFileOnFileSystem(fs, referenceFile);
2666         if (!success) {
2667           throw new IOException("Failed to create reference file:" + referenceFile);
2668         }
2669       }
2670     }
2671   }
2672 
2673   /**
2674    * Replaces any KV timestamps set to {@link HConstants#LATEST_TIMESTAMP} with the provided current
2675    * timestamp.
2676    */
2677   private void updateKVTimestamps(
2678       final Iterable<List<KeyValue>> keyLists, final byte[] now) {
2679     for (List<KeyValue> keys: keyLists) {
2680       if (keys == null) continue;
2681       for (KeyValue key : keys) {
2682         key.updateLatestStamp(now);
2683       }
2684     }
2685   }

2687   /*
2688    * Check if resources to support an update.
2689    *
2690    * Here we synchronize on HRegion, a broad scoped lock.  Its appropriate
2691    * given we're figuring in here whether this region is able to take on
2692    * writes.  This is only method with a synchronize (at time of writing),
2693    * this and the synchronize on 'this' inside in internalFlushCache to send
2694    * the notify.
2695    */
2696   private void checkResources()
2697       throws RegionTooBusyException, InterruptedIOException {
2698 
2699     // If catalog region, do not impose resource constraints or block updates.
2700     if (this.getRegionInfo().isMetaRegion()) return;
2701 
2702     boolean blocked = false;
2703     long startTime = 0;
2704     while (this.memstoreSize.get() > this.blockingMemStoreSize) {
2705       requestFlush();
2706       if (!blocked) {
2707         startTime = EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTimeMillis();
2708         LOG.info("Blocking updates for '" + Thread.currentThread().getName() +
2709           "' on region " + Bytes.toStringBinary(getRegionName()) +
2710           ": memstore size " +
2711           StringUtils.humanReadableInt(this.memstoreSize.get()) +
2712           " is >= than blocking " +
2713           StringUtils.humanReadableInt(this.blockingMemStoreSize) + " size");
2714       }
2715       long now = EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTimeMillis();
2716       long timeToWait = startTime + busyWaitDuration - now;
2717       if (timeToWait <= 0L) {
2718         final long totalTime = now - startTime;
2719         this.updatesBlockedMs.add(totalTime);
2720         LOG.info("Failed to unblock updates for region " + this + " '"
2721           + Thread.currentThread().getName() + "' in " + totalTime
2722           + "ms. The region is still busy.");
2723         throw new RegionTooBusyException("region is flushing");
2724       }
2725       blocked = true;
2726       synchronized(this) {
2727         try {
2728           wait(Math.min(timeToWait, threadWakeFrequency));
2729         } catch (InterruptedException ie) {
2730           final long totalTime = EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTimeMillis() - startTime;
2731           if (totalTime > 0) {
2732             this.updatesBlockedMs.add(totalTime);
2733           }
2734           LOG.info("Interrupted while waiting to unblock updates for region "
2735             + this + " '" + Thread.currentThread().getName() + "'");
2736           InterruptedIOException iie = new InterruptedIOException();
2737           iie.initCause(ie);
2738           throw iie;
2739         }
2740       }
2741     }
2742     if (blocked) {
2743       // Add in the blocked time if appropriate
2744       final long totalTime = EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTimeMillis() - startTime;
2745       if(totalTime > 0 ){
2746         this.updatesBlockedMs.add(totalTime);
2747       }
2748       LOG.info("Unblocking updates for region " + this + " '"
2749           + Thread.currentThread().getName() + "'");
2750     }
2751   }

2757     if (this.writestate.isReadOnly()) {
2758       throw new IOException("region is read only");

2762   /**
2763    * Add updates first to the hlog and then add values to memstore.
2764    * Warning: Assumption is caller has lock on passed in row.
2765    * @param family
2766    * @param edits Cell updates by column
2767    * @praram now
2768    * @throws IOException
2769    */
2770   private void put(byte [] family, List<KeyValue> edits)
2771   throws IOException {
2772     Map<byte[], List<KeyValue>> familyMap;
2773     familyMap = new HashMap<byte[], List<KeyValue>>();
2774 
2775     familyMap.put(family, edits);
2776     Put p = new Put();
2777     p.setFamilyMap(familyMap);
2778     p.setClusterId(HConstants.DEFAULT_CLUSTER_ID);
2779     p.setWriteToWAL(true);
2780     this.internalPut(p, HConstants.DEFAULT_CLUSTER_ID, true);
2781   }
2782 
2783   /**
2784    * Add updates first to the hlog (if writeToWal) and then add values to memstore.
2785    * Warning: Assumption is caller has lock on passed in row.
2786    * @param put The Put command
2787    * @param clusterId UUID of the originating cluster (for replication).
2788    * @param writeToWAL if true, then we should write to the log
2789    * @throws IOException
2790    */
2791   private void internalPut(Put put, UUID clusterId, boolean writeToWAL) throws IOException {
2792     Map<byte[], List<KeyValue>> familyMap = put.getFamilyMap();
2793     WALEdit walEdit = new WALEdit();
2794     /* run pre put hook outside of lock to avoid deadlock */
2795     if (coprocessorHost != null) {
2796       if (coprocessorHost.prePut(put, walEdit, writeToWAL)) {
2797         return;
2798       }
2799     }
2800 
2801     long now = EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTimeMillis();
2802     byte[] byteNow = Bytes.toBytes(now);
2803     boolean flush = false;
2804 
2805     lock(this.updatesLock.readLock());
2806     try {
2807       checkFamilies(familyMap.keySet());
2808       checkTimestamps(familyMap, now);
2809       updateKVTimestamps(familyMap.values(), byteNow);
2810       // write/sync to WAL should happen before we touch memstore.
2811       //
2812       // If order is reversed, i.e. we write to memstore first, and
2813       // for some reason fail to write/sync to commit log, the memstore
2814       // will contain uncommitted transactions.
2815       if (writeToWAL) {
2816         addFamilyMapToWALEdit(familyMap, walEdit);
2817         this.log.append(regionInfo, this.htableDescriptor.getName(),
2818             walEdit, clusterId, now, this.htableDescriptor);
2819       } else {
2820         recordPutWithoutWal(familyMap);
2821       }
2822 
2823       long addedSize = applyFamilyMapToMemstore(familyMap, null);
2824       flush = isFlushSize(this.addAndGetGlobalMemstoreSize(addedSize));
2825     } finally {
2826       this.updatesLock.readLock().unlock();
2827     }
2828 
2829     if (coprocessorHost != null) {
2830       coprocessorHost.postPut(put, walEdit, writeToWAL);
2831     }
2832 
2833     // do after lock
2834     final long after = EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTimeMillis();
2835     this.opMetrics.updatePutMetrics(familyMap.keySet(), after - now);
2836 
2837     if (flush) {
2838       // Request a cache flush.  Do it outside update lock.
2839       requestFlush();
2840     }
2841   }
2842 
2843   /**
2844    * Atomically apply the given map of family->edits to the memstore.
2845    * This handles the consistency control on its own, but the caller
2846    * should already have locked updatesLock.readLock(). This also does
2847    * <b>not</b> check the families for validity.
2848    *
2849    * @param familyMap Map of kvs per family
2850    * @param localizedWriteEntry The WriteEntry of the MVCC for this transaction.
2851    *        If null, then this method internally creates a mvcc transaction.
2852    * @return the additional memory usage of the memstore caused by the
2853    * new entries.
2854    */
2855   private long applyFamilyMapToMemstore(Map<byte[], List<KeyValue>> familyMap,
2856     MultiVersionConsistencyControl.WriteEntry localizedWriteEntry) {
2857     long size = 0;
2858     boolean freemvcc = false;
2859 
2860     try {
2861       if (localizedWriteEntry == null) {
2862         localizedWriteEntry = mvcc.beginMemstoreInsert();
2863         freemvcc = true;
2864       }
2865 
2866       for (Map.Entry<byte[], List<KeyValue>> e : familyMap.entrySet()) {
2867         byte[] family = e.getKey();
2868         List<KeyValue> edits = e.getValue();
2869 
2870         Store store = getStore(family);
2871         for (KeyValue kv: edits) {
2872           kv.setMemstoreTS(localizedWriteEntry.getWriteNumber());
2873           size += store.add(kv);
2874         }
2875       }
2876     } finally {
2877       if (freemvcc) {
2878         mvcc.completeMemstoreInsert(localizedWriteEntry);
2879       }
2880     }
2881 
2882      return size;
2883    }
2884 
2885   /**
2886    * Remove all the keys listed in the map from the memstore. This method is
2887    * called when a Put/Delete has updated memstore but subequently fails to update
2888    * the wal. This method is then invoked to rollback the memstore.
2889    */
2890   private void rollbackMemstore(BatchOperationInProgress<Pair<Mutation, Integer>> batchOp,
2891                                 Map<byte[], List<KeyValue>>[] familyMaps,
2892                                 int start, int end) {
2893     int kvsRolledback = 0;
2894     for (int i = start; i < end; i++) {
2895       // skip over request that never succeeded in the first place.
2896       if (batchOp.retCodeDetails[i].getOperationStatusCode()
2897             != OperationStatusCode.SUCCESS) {
2898         continue;
2899       }
2900 
2901       // Rollback all the kvs for this row.
2902       Map<byte[], List<KeyValue>> familyMap  = familyMaps[i];
2903       for (Map.Entry<byte[], List<KeyValue>> e : familyMap.entrySet()) {
2904         byte[] family = e.getKey();
2905         List<KeyValue> edits = e.getValue();
2906 
2907         // Remove those keys from the memstore that matches our
2908         // key's (row, cf, cq, timestamp, memstoreTS). The interesting part is
2909         // that even the memstoreTS has to match for keys that will be rolleded-back.
2910         Store store = getStore(family);
2911         for (KeyValue kv: edits) {
2912           store.rollback(kv);
2913           kvsRolledback++;
2914         }
2915       }
2916     }
2917     LOG.debug("rollbackMemstore rolled back " + kvsRolledback +
2918         " keyvalues from start:" + start + " to end:" + end);
2919   }

2921   /**
2922    * Check the collection of families for validity.
2923    * @throws NoSuchColumnFamilyException if a family does not exist.
2924    */
2925   private void checkFamilies(Collection<byte[]> families)
2926   throws NoSuchColumnFamilyException {
2927     for (byte[] family : families) {
2928       checkFamily(family);
2929     }
2930   }
2931 
2932   private void checkTimestamps(final Map<byte[], List<KeyValue>> familyMap,
2933       long now) throws DoNotRetryIOException {
2934     if (timestampSlop == HConstants.LATEST_TIMESTAMP) {
2935       return;
2936     }
2937     long maxTs = now + timestampSlop;
2938     for (List<KeyValue> kvs : familyMap.values()) {
2939       for (KeyValue kv : kvs) {
2940         // see if the user-side TS is out of range. latest = server-side
2941         if (!kv.isLatestTimestamp() && kv.getTimestamp() > maxTs) {
2942           throw new DoNotRetryIOException("Timestamp for KV out of range "
2943               + kv + " (too.new=" + timestampSlop + ")");
2944         }
2945       }
2946     }
2947   }

2949   /**
2950    * Append the given map of family->edits to a WALEdit data structure.
2951    * This does not write to the HLog itself.
2952    * @param familyMap map of family->edits
2953    * @param walEdit the destination entry to append into
2954    */
2955   private void addFamilyMapToWALEdit(Map<byte[], List<KeyValue>> familyMap,
2956       WALEdit walEdit) {
2957     for (List<KeyValue> edits : familyMap.values()) {
2958       for (KeyValue kv : edits) {
2959         walEdit.add(kv);
2960       }
2961     }
2962   }

2964   private void requestFlush() {
2965     if (this.rsServices == null) {
2966       return;
2967     }
2968     synchronized (writestate) {
2969       if (this.writestate.isFlushRequested()) {
2970         return;
2971       }
2972       writestate.flushRequested = true;
2973     }
2974     // Make request outside of synchronize block; HBASE-818.
2975     this.rsServices.getFlushRequester().requestFlush(this);
2976     if (LOG.isDebugEnabled()) {
2977       LOG.debug("Flush requested on " + this);
2978     }
2979   }

2981   /*
2982    * @param size
2983    * @return True if size is over the flush threshold
2984    */
2985   private boolean isFlushSize(final long size) {
2986     return size > this.memstoreFlushSize;
2987   }
2988 
2989   /**
2990    * Read the edits log put under this region by wal log splitting process.  Put
2991    * the recovered edits back up into this region.
2992    *
2993    * <p>We can ignore any log message that has a sequence ID that's equal to or
2994    * lower than minSeqId.  (Because we know such log messages are already
2995    * reflected in the HFiles.)
2996    *
2997    * <p>While this is running we are putting pressure on memory yet we are
2998    * outside of our usual accounting because we are not yet an onlined region
2999    * (this stuff is being run as part of Region initialization).  This means
3000    * that if we're up against global memory limits, we'll not be flagged to flush
3001    * because we are not online. We can't be flushed by usual mechanisms anyways;
3002    * we're not yet online so our relative sequenceids are not yet aligned with
3003    * HLog sequenceids -- not till we come up online, post processing of split
3004    * edits.
3005    *
3006    * <p>But to help relieve memory pressure, at least manage our own heap size
3007    * flushing if are in excess of per-region limits.  Flushing, though, we have
3008    * to be careful and avoid using the regionserver/hlog sequenceid.  Its running
3009    * on a different line to whats going on in here in this region context so if we
3010    * crashed replaying these edits, but in the midst had a flush that used the
3011    * regionserver log with a sequenceid in excess of whats going on in here
3012    * in this region and with its split editlogs, then we could miss edits the
3013    * next time we go to recover. So, we have to flush inline, using seqids that
3014    * make sense in a this single region context only -- until we online.
3015    *
3016    * @param regiondir
3017    * @param minSeqId Any edit found in split editlogs needs to be in excess of
3018    * this minSeqId to be applied, else its skipped.
3019    * @param reporter
3020    * @return the sequence id of the last edit added to this region out of the
3021    * recovered edits log or <code>minSeqId</code> if nothing added from editlogs.
3022    * @throws UnsupportedEncodingException
3023    * @throws IOException
3024    */
3025   protected long replayRecoveredEditsIfAny(final Path regiondir,
3026       final long minSeqId, final CancelableProgressable reporter,
3027       final MonitoredTask status)
3028       throws UnsupportedEncodingException, IOException {
3029     long seqid = minSeqId;
3030     NavigableSet<Path> files = HLog.getSplitEditFilesSorted(this.fs, regiondir);
3031     if (files == null || files.isEmpty()) return seqid;
3032     for (Path edits: files) {
3033       if (edits == null || !this.fs.exists(edits)) {
3034         LOG.warn("Null or non-existent edits file: " + edits);
3035         continue;
3036       }
3037       if (isZeroLengthThenDelete(this.fs, edits)) continue;
3038 
3039       long maxSeqId = Long.MAX_VALUE;
3040       String fileName = edits.getName();
3041       maxSeqId = Math.abs(Long.parseLong(fileName));
3042       if (maxSeqId <= minSeqId) {
3043         String msg = "Maximum sequenceid for this log is " + maxSeqId
3044             + " and minimum sequenceid for the region is " + minSeqId
3045             + ", skipped the whole file, path=" + edits;
3046         LOG.debug(msg);
3047         continue;
3048       }
3049 
3050       try {
3051         seqid = replayRecoveredEdits(edits, seqid, reporter);
3052       } catch (IOException e) {
3053         boolean skipErrors = conf.getBoolean("hbase.skip.errors", false);
3054         if (skipErrors) {
3055           Path p = HLog.moveAsideBadEditsFile(fs, edits);
3056           LOG.error("hbase.skip.errors=true so continuing. Renamed " + edits +
3057             " as " + p, e);
3058         } else {
3059           throw e;
3060         }
3061       }
3062       // The edits size added into rsAccounting during this replaying will not
3063       // be required any more. So just clear it.
3064       if (this.rsAccounting != null) {
3065         this.rsAccounting.clearRegionReplayEditsSize(this.regionInfo.getRegionName());
3066       }
3067     }
3068     if (seqid > minSeqId) {
3069       // Then we added some edits to memory. Flush and cleanup split edit files.
3070       internalFlushcache(null, seqid, status);
3071     }
3072     // Now delete the content of recovered edits.  We're done w/ them.
3073     for (Path file: files) {
3074       if (!HBaseFileSystem.deleteFileFromFileSystem(fs, file)) {
3075         LOG.error("Failed delete of " + file);
3076       } else {
3077         LOG.debug("Deleted recovered.edits file=" + file);
3078       }
3079     }
3080     return seqid;
3081   }
3082 
3083   /*
3084    * @param edits File of recovered edits.
3085    * @param minSeqId Minimum sequenceid found in a store file.  Edits in log
3086    * must be larger than this to be replayed.
3087    * @param reporter
3088    * @return the sequence id of the last edit added to this region out of the
3089    * recovered edits log or <code>minSeqId</code> if nothing added from editlogs.
3090    * @throws IOException
3091    */
3092   private long replayRecoveredEdits(final Path edits,
3093       final long minSeqId, final CancelableProgressable reporter)
3094     throws IOException {
3095     String msg = "Replaying edits from " + edits + "; minSequenceid=" +
3096       minSeqId + "; path=" + edits;
3097     LOG.info(msg);
3098     MonitoredTask status = TaskMonitor.get().createStatus(msg);
3099 
3100     status.setStatus("Opening logs");
3101     HLog.Reader reader = null;
3102     try {
3103       reader = HLog.getReader(this.fs, edits, conf);
3104       long currentEditSeqId = minSeqId;
3105       long firstSeqIdInLog = -1;
3106       long skippedEdits = 0;
3107       long editsCount = 0;
3108       long intervalEdits = 0;
3109       HLog.Entry entry;
3110       Store store = null;
3111       boolean reported_once = false;
3112 
3113       try {
3114         // How many edits seen before we check elapsed time
3115         int interval = this.conf.getInt("hbase.hstore.report.interval.edits",
3116             2000);
3117         // How often to send a progress report (default 1/2 master timeout)
3118         int period = this.conf.getInt("hbase.hstore.report.period",
3119             this.conf.getInt("hbase.master.assignment.timeoutmonitor.timeout",
3120                 180000) / 2);
3121         long lastReport = EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTimeMillis();
3122 
3123         while ((entry = reader.next()) != null) {
3124           HLogKey key = entry.getKey();
3125           WALEdit val = entry.getEdit();
3126 
3127           if (reporter != null) {
3128             intervalEdits += val.size();
3129             if (intervalEdits >= interval) {
3130               // Number of edits interval reached
3131               intervalEdits = 0;
3132               long cur = EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTimeMillis();
3133               if (lastReport + period <= cur) {
3134                 status.setStatus("Replaying edits..." +
3135                     " skipped=" + skippedEdits +
3136                     " edits=" + editsCount);
3137                 // Timeout reached
3138                 if(!reporter.progress()) {
3139                   msg = "Progressable reporter failed, stopping replay";
3140                   LOG.warn(msg);
3141                   status.abort(msg);
3142                   throw new IOException(msg);
3143                 }
3144                 reported_once = true;
3145                 lastReport = cur;
3146               }
3147             }
3148           }
3149 
3150           // Start coprocessor replay here. The coprocessor is for each WALEdit
3151           // instead of a KeyValue.
3152           if (coprocessorHost != null) {
3153             status.setStatus("Running pre-WAL-restore hook in coprocessors");
3154             if (coprocessorHost.preWALRestore(this.getRegionInfo(), key, val)) {
3155               // if bypass this log entry, ignore it ...
3156               continue;
3157             }
3158           }
3159 
3160           if (firstSeqIdInLog == -1) {
3161             firstSeqIdInLog = key.getLogSeqNum();
3162           }
3163           // Now, figure if we should skip this edit.
3164           if (key.getLogSeqNum() <= currentEditSeqId) {
3165             skippedEdits++;
3166             continue;
3167           }
3168           currentEditSeqId = key.getLogSeqNum();
3169           boolean flush = false;
3170           for (KeyValue kv: val.getKeyValues()) {
3171             // Check this edit is for me. Also, guard against writing the special
3172             // METACOLUMN info such as HBASE::CACHEFLUSH entries
3173             if (kv.matchingFamily(HLog.METAFAMILY) ||
3174                 !Bytes.equals(key.getEncodedRegionName(), this.regionInfo.getEncodedNameAsBytes())) {
3175               skippedEdits++;
3176               continue;
3177                 }
3178             // Figure which store the edit is meant for.
3179             if (store == null || !kv.matchingFamily(store.getFamily().getName())) {
3180               store = this.stores.get(kv.getFamily());
3181             }
3182             if (store == null) {
3183               // This should never happen.  Perhaps schema was changed between
3184               // crash and redeploy?
3185               LOG.warn("No family for " + kv);
3186               skippedEdits++;
3187               continue;
3188             }
3189             // Once we are over the limit, restoreEdit will keep returning true to
3190             // flush -- but don't flush until we've played all the kvs that make up
3191             // the WALEdit.
3192             flush = restoreEdit(store, kv);
3193             editsCount++;
3194           }
3195           if (flush) internalFlushcache(null, currentEditSeqId, status);
3196 
3197           if (coprocessorHost != null) {
3198             coprocessorHost.postWALRestore(this.getRegionInfo(), key, val);
3199           }
3200         }
3201       } catch (EOFException eof) {
3202         Path p = HLog.moveAsideBadEditsFile(fs, edits);
3203         msg = "Encountered EOF. Most likely due to Master failure during " +
3204             "log spliting, so we have this data in another edit.  " +
3205             "Continuing, but renaming " + edits + " as " + p;
3206         LOG.warn(msg, eof);
3207         status.abort(msg);
3208       } catch (IOException ioe) {
3209         // If the IOE resulted from bad file format,
3210         // then this problem is idempotent and retrying won't help
3211         if (ioe.getCause() instanceof ParseException) {
3212           Path p = HLog.moveAsideBadEditsFile(fs, edits);
3213           msg = "File corruption encountered!  " +
3214               "Continuing, but renaming " + edits + " as " + p;
3215           LOG.warn(msg, ioe);
3216           status.setStatus(msg);
3217         } else {
3218           status.abort(StringUtils.stringifyException(ioe));
3219           // other IO errors may be transient (bad network connection,
3220           // checksum exception on one datanode, etc).  throw & retry
3221           throw ioe;
3222         }
3223       }
3224       if (reporter != null && !reported_once) {
3225         reporter.progress();
3226       }
3227       msg = "Applied " + editsCount + ", skipped " + skippedEdits +
3228         ", firstSequenceidInLog=" + firstSeqIdInLog +
3229         ", maxSequenceidInLog=" + currentEditSeqId + ", path=" + edits;
3230       status.markComplete(msg);
3231       LOG.debug(msg);
3232       return currentEditSeqId;
3233     } finally {
3234       status.cleanup();
3235       if (reader != null) {
3236          reader.close();
3237       }
3238     }
3239   }

3330   /**
3331    * Obtain a lock on the given row.  Blocks until success.
3332    *
3333    * I know it's strange to have two mappings:
3334    * <pre>
3335    *   ROWS  ==> LOCKS
3336    * </pre>
3337    * as well as
3338    * <pre>
3339    *   LOCKS ==> ROWS
3340    * </pre>
3341    *
3342    * But it acts as a guard on the client; a miswritten client just can't
3343    * submit the name of a row and start writing to it; it must know the correct
3344    * lockid, which matches the lock list in memory.
3345    *
3346    * <p>It would be more memory-efficient to assume a correctly-written client,
3347    * which maybe we'll do in the future.
3348    *
3349    * @param row Name of row to lock.
3350    * @throws IOException
3351    * @return The id of the held lock.
3352    */
3353   public Integer obtainRowLock(final byte [] row) throws IOException {
3354     startRegionOperation();
3355     this.writeRequestsCount.increment();
3356     this.opMetrics.setWriteRequestCountMetrics( this.writeRequestsCount.get());
3357     try {
3358       return internalObtainRowLock(row, true);
3359     } finally {
3360       closeRegionOperation();
3361     }
3362   }
3363 
3364   /**
3365    * Obtains or tries to obtain the given row lock.
3366    * @param waitForLock if true, will block until the lock is available.
3367    *        Otherwise, just tries to obtain the lock and returns
3368    *        null if unavailable.
3369    */
3370   private Integer internalObtainRowLock(final byte[] row, boolean waitForLock)
3371       throws IOException {
3372     checkRow(row, "row lock");
3373     startRegionOperation();
3374     try {
3375       HashedBytes rowKey = new HashedBytes(row);
3376       CountDownLatch rowLatch = new CountDownLatch(1);
3377 
3378       // loop until we acquire the row lock (unless !waitForLock)
3379       while (true) {
3380         CountDownLatch existingLatch = lockedRows.putIfAbsent(rowKey, rowLatch);
3381         if (existingLatch == null) {
3382           break;
3383         } else {
3384           // row already locked
3385           if (!waitForLock) {
3386             return null;
3387           }
3388           try {
3389             if (!existingLatch.await(this.rowLockWaitDuration,
3390                             TimeUnit.MILLISECONDS)) {
3391               throw new IOException("Timed out on getting lock for row="
3392                   + Bytes.toStringBinary(row));
3393             }
3394           } catch (InterruptedException ie) {
3395             // Empty
3396           }
3397         }
3398       }
3399 
3400       // loop until we generate an unused lock id
3401       while (true) {
3402         Integer lockId = lockIdGenerator.incrementAndGet();
3403         HashedBytes existingRowKey = lockIds.putIfAbsent(lockId, rowKey);
3404         if (existingRowKey == null) {
3405           return lockId;
3406         } else {
3407           // lockId already in use, jump generator to a new spot
3408           lockIdGenerator.set(rand.nextInt());
3409         }
3410       }
3411     } finally {
3412       closeRegionOperation();
3413     }
3414   }

3416   /**
3417    * Used by unit tests.
3418    * @param lockid
3419    * @return Row that goes with <code>lockid</code>
3420    */
3421   byte[] getRowFromLock(final Integer lockid) {
3422     HashedBytes rowKey = lockIds.get(lockid);
3423     return rowKey == null ? null : rowKey.getBytes();
3424   }
3425 
3426   /**
3427    * Release the row lock!
3428    * @param lockId  The lock ID to release.
3429    */
3430   public void releaseRowLock(final Integer lockId) {
3431     if (lockId == null) return; // null lock id, do nothing
3432     HashedBytes rowKey = lockIds.remove(lockId);
3433     if (rowKey == null) {
3434       LOG.warn("Release unknown lockId: " + lockId);
3435       return;
3436     }
3437     CountDownLatch rowLatch = lockedRows.remove(rowKey);
3438     if (rowLatch == null) {
3439       LOG.error("Releases row not locked, lockId: " + lockId + " row: "
3440           + rowKey);
3441       return;
3442     }
3443     rowLatch.countDown();
3444   }

3446   /**
3447    * See if row is currently locked.
3448    * @param lockid
3449    * @return boolean
3450    */
3451   boolean isRowLocked(final Integer lockId) {
3452     return lockIds.containsKey(lockId);
3453   }

3455   /**
3456    * Returns existing row lock if found, otherwise
3457    * obtains a new row lock and returns it.
3458    * @param lockid requested by the user, or null if the user didn't already hold lock
3459    * @param row the row to lock
3460    * @param waitForLock if true, will block until the lock is available, otherwise will
3461    * simply return null if it could not acquire the lock.
3462    * @return lockid or null if waitForLock is false and the lock was unavailable.
3463    */
3464   public Integer getLock(Integer lockid, byte [] row, boolean waitForLock)
3465   throws IOException {
3466     Integer lid = null;
3467     if (lockid == null) {
3468       lid = internalObtainRowLock(row, waitForLock);
3469     } else {
3470       if (!isRowLocked(lockid)) {
3471         throw new IOException("Invalid row lock");
3472       }
3473       lid = lockid;
3474     }
3475     return lid;
3476   }

3478   /**
3479    * Determines whether multiple column families are present
3480    * Precondition: familyPaths is not null
3481    *
3482    * @param familyPaths List of Pair<byte[] column family, String hfilePath>
3483    */
3484   private static boolean hasMultipleColumnFamilies(
3485       List<Pair<byte[], String>> familyPaths) {
3486     boolean multipleFamilies = false;
3487     byte[] family = null;
3488     for (Pair<byte[], String> pair : familyPaths) {
3489       byte[] fam = pair.getFirst();
3490       if (family == null) {
3491         family = fam;
3492       } else if (!Bytes.equals(family, fam)) {
3493         multipleFamilies = true;
3494         break;
3495       }
3496     }
3497     return multipleFamilies;
3498   }

3500   /**
3501    * Attempts to atomically load a group of hfiles.  This is critical for loading
3502    * rows with multiple column families atomically.
3503    *
3504    * @param familyPaths List of Pair<byte[] column family, String hfilePath>
3505    * @return true if successful, false if failed recoverably
3506    * @throws IOException if failed unrecoverably.
3507    */
3508   public boolean bulkLoadHFiles(List<Pair<byte[], String>> familyPaths) throws IOException {
3509     return bulkLoadHFiles(familyPaths, null);
3510   }
3511 
3512   /**
3513    * Attempts to atomically load a group of hfiles.  This is critical for loading
3514    * rows with multiple column families atomically.
3515    *
3516    * @param familyPaths List of Pair<byte[] column family, String hfilePath>
3517    * @param bulkLoadListener Internal hooks enabling massaging/preparation of a
3518    * file about to be bulk loaded
3519    * @return true if successful, false if failed recoverably
3520    * @throws IOException if failed unrecoverably.
3521    */
3522   public boolean bulkLoadHFiles(List<Pair<byte[], String>> familyPaths,
3523       BulkLoadListener bulkLoadListener) throws IOException {
3524     Preconditions.checkNotNull(familyPaths);
3525     // we need writeLock for multi-family bulk load
3526     startBulkRegionOperation(hasMultipleColumnFamilies(familyPaths));
3527     try {
3528       this.writeRequestsCount.increment();
3529       this.opMetrics.setWriteRequestCountMetrics( this.writeRequestsCount.get());
3530 
3531       // There possibly was a split that happend between when the split keys
3532       // were gathered and before the HReiogn's write lock was taken.  We need
3533       // to validate the HFile region before attempting to bulk load all of them
3534       List<IOException> ioes = new ArrayList<IOException>();
3535       List<Pair<byte[], String>> failures = new ArrayList<Pair<byte[], String>>();
3536       for (Pair<byte[], String> p : familyPaths) {
3537         byte[] familyName = p.getFirst();
3538         String path = p.getSecond();
3539 
3540         Store store = getStore(familyName);
3541         if (store == null) {
3542           IOException ioe = new DoNotRetryIOException(
3543               "No such column family " + Bytes.toStringBinary(familyName));
3544           ioes.add(ioe);
3545         } else {
3546           try {
3547             store.assertBulkLoadHFileOk(new Path(path));
3548           } catch (WrongRegionException wre) {
3549             // recoverable (file doesn't fit in region)
3550             failures.add(p);
3551           } catch (IOException ioe) {
3552             // unrecoverable (hdfs problem)
3553             ioes.add(ioe);
3554           }
3555         }
3556       }
3557 
3558       // validation failed because of some sort of IO problem.
3559       if (ioes.size() != 0) {
3560         IOException e = MultipleIOException.createIOException(ioes);
3561         LOG.error("There were one or more IO errors when checking if the bulk load is ok.", e);
3562         throw e;
3563       }
3564 
3565       // validation failed, bail out before doing anything permanent.
3566       if (failures.size() != 0) {
3567         StringBuilder list = new StringBuilder();
3568         for (Pair<byte[], String> p : failures) {
3569           list.append("\n").append(Bytes.toString(p.getFirst())).append(" : ")
3570             .append(p.getSecond());
3571         }
3572         // problem when validating
3573         LOG.warn("There was a recoverable bulk load failure likely due to a" +
3574             " split.  These (family, HFile) pairs were not loaded: " + list);
3575         return false;
3576       }
3577 
3578       for (Pair<byte[], String> p : familyPaths) {
3579         byte[] familyName = p.getFirst();
3580         String path = p.getSecond();
3581         Store store = getStore(familyName);
3582         try {
3583           String finalPath = path;
3584           if(bulkLoadListener != null) {
3585             finalPath = bulkLoadListener.prepareBulkLoad(familyName, path);
3586           }
3587           store.bulkLoadHFile(finalPath);
3588           if(bulkLoadListener != null) {
3589             bulkLoadListener.doneBulkLoad(familyName, path);
3590           }
3591         } catch (IOException ioe) {
3592           // a failure here causes an atomicity violation that we currently
3593           // cannot recover from since it is likely a failed hdfs operation.
3594 
3595           // TODO Need a better story for reverting partial failures due to HDFS.
3596           LOG.error("There was a partial failure due to IO when attempting to" +
3597               " load " + Bytes.toString(p.getFirst()) + " : "+ p.getSecond());
3598           if(bulkLoadListener != null) {
3599             try {
3600               bulkLoadListener.failedBulkLoad(familyName, path);
3601             } catch (Exception ex) {
3602               LOG.error("Error while calling failedBulkLoad for family "+
3603                   Bytes.toString(familyName)+" with path "+path, ex);
3604             }
3605           }
3606           throw ioe;
3607         }
3608       }
3609       return true;
3610     } finally {
3611       closeBulkRegionOperation();
3612     }
3613   }

3638   /**
3639    * RegionScannerImpl is used to combine scanners from multiple Stores (aka column families).
3640    */
3641   class RegionScannerImpl implements RegionScanner {
3642     // Package local for testability
3643     KeyValueHeap storeHeap = null;
3644     /** Heap of key-values that are not essential for the provided filters and are thus read
3645      * on demand, if on-demand column family loading is enabled.*/
3646     KeyValueHeap joinedHeap = null;
3647     /**
3648      * If the joined heap data gathering is interrupted due to scan limits, this will
3649      * contain the row for which we are populating the values.*/
3650     private KeyValue joinedContinuationRow = null;
3651     // KeyValue indicating that limit is reached when scanning
3652     private final KeyValue KV_LIMIT = new KeyValue();
3653     private final byte [] stopRow;
3654     private Filter filter;
3655     private List<KeyValue> results = new ArrayList<KeyValue>();
3656     private int batch;
3657     private int isScan;
3658     private boolean filterClosed = false;
3659     private long readPt;
3660     private HRegion region;
3661 
3662     public HRegionInfo getRegionInfo() {
3663       return regionInfo;
3664     }
3665     
3666     RegionScannerImpl(Scan scan, List<KeyValueScanner> additionalScanners, HRegion region)
3667         throws IOException {
3668       // DebugPrint.println("HRegionScanner.<init>");
3669       this.region = region;
3670       this.filter = scan.getFilter();
3671       this.batch = scan.getBatch();
3672       if (Bytes.equals(scan.getStopRow(), HConstants.EMPTY_END_ROW)) {
3673         this.stopRow = null;
3674       } else {
3675         this.stopRow = scan.getStopRow();
3676       }
3677       // If we are doing a get, we want to be [startRow,endRow] normally
3678       // it is [startRow,endRow) and if startRow=endRow we get nothing.
3679       this.isScan = scan.isGetScan() ? -1 : 0;
3680 
3681       // synchronize on scannerReadPoints so that nobody calculates
3682       // getSmallestReadPoint, before scannerReadPoints is updated.
3683       IsolationLevel isolationLevel = scan.getIsolationLevel();
3684       synchronized(scannerReadPoints) {
3685         if (isolationLevel == IsolationLevel.READ_UNCOMMITTED) {
3686           // This scan can read even uncommitted transactions
3687           this.readPt = Long.MAX_VALUE;
3688           MultiVersionConsistencyControl.setThreadReadPoint(this.readPt);
3689         } else {
3690           this.readPt = MultiVersionConsistencyControl.resetThreadReadPoint(mvcc);
3691         }
3692         scannerReadPoints.put(this, this.readPt);
3693       }
3694 
3695       // Here we separate all scanners into two lists - scanner that provide data required
3696       // by the filter to operate (scanners list) and all others (joinedScanners list).
3697       List<KeyValueScanner> scanners = new ArrayList<KeyValueScanner>();
3698       List<KeyValueScanner> joinedScanners = new ArrayList<KeyValueScanner>();
3699       if (additionalScanners != null) {
3700         scanners.addAll(additionalScanners);
3701       }
3702 
3703       for (Map.Entry<byte[], NavigableSet<byte[]>> entry :
3704           scan.getFamilyMap().entrySet()) {
3705         Store store = stores.get(entry.getKey());
3706         KeyValueScanner scanner = store.getScanner(scan, entry.getValue());
3707         if (this.filter == null || !scan.doLoadColumnFamiliesOnDemand()
3708           || FilterBase.isFamilyEssential(this.filter, entry.getKey())) {
3709           scanners.add(scanner);
3710         } else {
3711           joinedScanners.add(scanner);
3712         }
3713       }
3714       this.storeHeap = new KeyValueHeap(scanners, comparator);
3715       if (!joinedScanners.isEmpty()) {
3716         this.joinedHeap = new KeyValueHeap(joinedScanners, comparator);
3717       }
3718     }
3719 
3720     RegionScannerImpl(Scan scan, HRegion region) throws IOException {
3721       this(scan, null, region);
3722     }

3725     public long getMvccReadPoint() {
3726       return this.readPt;
3727     }

3743     @Override
3744     public synchronized boolean next(List<KeyValue> outResults, int limit,
3745         String metric) throws IOException {
3746       if (this.filterClosed) {
3747         throw new UnknownScannerException("Scanner was closed (timed out?) " +
3748             "after we renewed it. Could be caused by a very slow scanner " +
3749             "or a lengthy garbage collection");
3750       }
3751       startRegionOperation();
3752       readRequestsCount.increment();
3753       opMetrics.setReadRequestCountMetrics(readRequestsCount.get());
3754       try {
3755 
3756         // This could be a new thread from the last time we called next().
3757         MultiVersionConsistencyControl.setThreadReadPoint(this.readPt);
3758 
3759         return nextRaw(outResults, limit, metric);
3760       } finally {
3761         closeRegionOperation();
3762       }
3763     }

3765     @Override
3766     public boolean nextRaw(List<KeyValue> outResults, String metric)
3767         throws IOException {
3768       return nextRaw(outResults, batch, metric);
3769     }
3770 
3771     @Override
3772     public boolean nextRaw(List<KeyValue> outResults, int limit,
3773         String metric) throws IOException {
3774       results.clear();
3775 
3776       boolean returnResult = nextInternal(limit, metric);
3777 
3778       outResults.addAll(results);
3779       resetFilters();
3780       if (isFilterDone()) {
3781         return false;
3782       }
3783       return returnResult;
3784     }
