3800     private void populateFromJoinedHeap(int limit, String metric) throws IOException {
3801       assert joinedContinuationRow != null;
3802       KeyValue kv = populateResult(this.joinedHeap, limit, joinedContinuationRow.getBuffer(),
3803         joinedContinuationRow.getRowOffset(), joinedContinuationRow.getRowLength(), metric);
3804       if (kv != KV_LIMIT) {
3805         // We are done with this row, reset the continuation.
3806         joinedContinuationRow = null;
3807       }
3808       // As the data is obtained from two independent heaps, we need to
3809       // ensure that result list is sorted, because Result relies on that.
3810       Collections.sort(results, comparator);
3811     }
3812 
3813     /**
3814      * Fetches records with this row into result list, until next row or limit (if not -1).
3815      * @param heap KeyValueHeap to fetch data from. It must be positioned on correct row before call.
3816      * @param limit Max amount of KVs to place in result list, -1 means no limit.
3817      * @param currentRow Byte array with key we are fetching.
3818      * @param offset offset for currentRow
3819      * @param length length for currentRow
3820      * @param metric Metric key to be passed into KeyValueHeap::next().
3821      * @return true if limit reached, false otherwise.
3822      */
3823     private KeyValue populateResult(KeyValueHeap heap, int limit, byte[] currentRow, int offset,
3824         short length, String metric) throws IOException {
3825       KeyValue nextKv;
3826       do {
3827         heap.next(results, limit - results.size(), metric);
3828         if (limit > 0 && results.size() == limit) {
3829           return KV_LIMIT;
3830         }
3831         nextKv = heap.peek();
3832       } while (nextKv != null && nextKv.matchingRow(currentRow, offset, length));
3833       return nextKv;
3834     }
3835 
3836     /*
3837      * @return True if a filter rules the scanner is over, done.
3838      */
3839     public synchronized boolean isFilterDone() {
3840       return this.filter != null && this.filter.filterAllRemaining();
3841     }
3842 
3843     private boolean nextInternal(int limit, String metric) throws IOException {
3844       RpcCallContext rpcCall = HBaseServer.getCurrentCall();
3845       // The loop here is used only when at some point during the next we determine
3846       // that due to effects of filters or otherwise, we have an empty row in the result.
3847       // Then we loop and try again. Otherwise, we must get out on the first iteration via return,
3848       // "true" if there's more data to read, "false" if there isn't (storeHeap is at a stop row,
3849       // and joinedHeap has no more data to read for the last row (if set, joinedContinuationRow).
3850       while (true) {
3851         if (rpcCall != null) {
3852           // If a user specifies a too-restrictive or too-slow scanner, the
3853           // client might time out and disconnect while the server side
3854           // is still processing the request. We should abort aggressively
3855           // in that case.
3856           rpcCall.throwExceptionIfCallerDisconnected();
3857         }
3858 
3859         // Let's see what we have in the storeHeap.
3860         KeyValue current = this.storeHeap.peek();
3861 
3862         byte[] currentRow = null;
3863         int offset = 0;
3864         short length = 0;
3865         if (current != null) {
3866           currentRow = current.getBuffer();
3867           offset = current.getRowOffset();
3868           length = current.getRowLength();
3869         }
3870         boolean stopRow = isStopRow(currentRow, offset, length);
3871         // Check if we were getting data from the joinedHeap abd hit the limit.
3872         // If not, then it's main path - getting results from storeHeap.
3873         if (joinedContinuationRow == null) {
3874           // First, check if we are at a stop row. If so, there are no more results.
3875           if (stopRow) {
3876             if (filter != null && filter.hasFilterRow()) {
3877               filter.filterRow(results);
3878             }
3879             if (filter != null && filter.filterRow()) {
3880               results.clear();
3881             }
3882             return false;
3883           }
3884 
3885           // Check if rowkey filter wants to exclude this row. If so, loop to next.
3886           // Techically, if we hit limits before on this row, we don't need this call.
3887           if (filterRowKey(currentRow, offset, length)) {
3888             boolean moreRows = nextRow(currentRow, offset, length);
3889             if (!moreRows) return false;
3890             continue;
3891           }
3892 
3893           // Ok, we are good, let's try to get some results from the main heap.
3894           KeyValue nextKv = populateResult(this.storeHeap, limit, currentRow, offset, length, metric);
3895           if (nextKv == KV_LIMIT) {
3896             if (this.filter != null && filter.hasFilterRow()) {
3897               throw new IncompatibleFilterException(
3898                 "Filter whose hasFilterRow() returns true is incompatible with scan with limit!");
3899             }
3900             return true; // We hit the limit.
3901           }
3902           stopRow = nextKv == null || isStopRow(nextKv.getBuffer(), nextKv.getRowOffset(), nextKv.getRowLength());
3903           // save that the row was empty before filters applied to it.
3904           final boolean isEmptyRow = results.isEmpty();
3905 
3906           // We have the part of the row necessary for filtering (all of it, usually).
3907           // First filter with the filterRow(List).            
3908           if (filter != null && filter.hasFilterRow()) {
3909             filter.filterRow(results);
3910           }
3911 
3912           if (isEmptyRow || filterRow()) {
3913             // this seems like a redundant step - we already consumed the row
3914             // there're no left overs.
3915             // the reasons for calling this method are:
3916             // 1. reset the filters.
3917             // 2. provide a hook to fast forward the row (used by subclasses)
3918             boolean moreRows = nextRow(currentRow, offset, length);
3919             if (!moreRows) return false;
3920 
3921             // This row was totally filtered out, if this is NOT the last row,
3922             // we should continue on. Otherwise, nothing else to do.
3923             if (!stopRow) continue;
3924             return false;
3925           }
3926 
3927           // Ok, we are done with storeHeap for this row.
3928           // Now we may need to fetch additional, non-essential data into row.
3929           // These values are not needed for filter to work, so we postpone their
3930           // fetch to (possibly) reduce amount of data loads from disk.
3931           if (this.joinedHeap != null) {
3932             KeyValue nextJoinedKv = joinedHeap.peek();
3933             // If joinedHeap is pointing to some other row, try to seek to a correct one.
3934             boolean mayHaveData =
3935               (nextJoinedKv != null && nextJoinedKv.matchingRow(currentRow, offset, length))
3936                 || (this.joinedHeap.requestSeek(
3937                     KeyValue.createFirstOnRow(currentRow, offset, length), true, true)
3938                   && joinedHeap.peek() != null
3939                   && joinedHeap.peek().matchingRow(currentRow, offset, length));
3940             if (mayHaveData) {
3941               joinedContinuationRow = current;
3942               populateFromJoinedHeap(limit, metric);
3943             }
3944           }
3945         } else {
3946           // Populating from the joined map was stopped by limits, populate some more.
3947           populateFromJoinedHeap(limit, metric);
3948         }
3949 
3950         // We may have just called populateFromJoinedMap and hit the limits. If that is
3951         // the case, we need to call it again on the next next() invocation.
3952         if (joinedContinuationRow != null) {
3953           return true;
3954         }
3955 
3956         // Finally, we are done with both joinedHeap and storeHeap.
3957         // Double check to prevent empty rows from appearing in result. It could be
3958         // the case when SingleValueExcludeFilter is used.
3959         if (results.isEmpty()) {
3960           boolean moreRows = nextRow(currentRow, offset, length);
3961           if (!moreRows) return false;
3962           if (!stopRow) continue;
3963         }
3964 
3965         // We are done. Return the result.
3966         return !stopRow;
3967       }
3968     }
3969 
3970     private boolean filterRow() {
3971       return filter != null
3972           && filter.filterRow();
3973     }
3974     private boolean filterRowKey(byte[] row, int offset, short length) {
3975       return filter != null
3976           && filter.filterRowKey(row, offset, length);
3977     }
3978 
3979     protected boolean nextRow(byte [] currentRow, int offset, short length) throws IOException {
3980       KeyValue next;
3981       while((next = this.storeHeap.peek()) != null && next.matchingRow(currentRow, offset, length)) {
3982         this.storeHeap.next(MOCKED_LIST);       
3983       }
3984       results.clear();
3985       resetFilters();
3986       // Calling the hook in CP which allows it to do a fast forward
3987       if (this.region.getCoprocessorHost() != null) {
3988         return this.region.getCoprocessorHost().postScannerFilterRow(this, currentRow);
3989       }
3990       return true;
3991     }
3992 
3993     private boolean isStopRow(byte [] currentRow, int offset, short length) {
3994       return currentRow == null ||
3995           (stopRow != null &&
3996           comparator.compareRows(stopRow, 0, stopRow.length,
3997               currentRow, offset, length) <= isScan);
3998     }

4000     @Override
4001     public synchronized void close() {
4002       if (storeHeap != null) {
4003         storeHeap.close();
4004         storeHeap = null;
4005       }
4006       if (joinedHeap != null) {
4007         joinedHeap.close();
4008         joinedHeap = null;
4009       }
4010       // no need to sychronize here.
4011       scannerReadPoints.remove(this);
4012       this.filterClosed = true;
4013     }

4015     KeyValueHeap getStoreHeapForTesting() {
4016       return storeHeap;
4017     }

4019     @Override
4020     public synchronized boolean reseek(byte[] row) throws IOException {
4021       if (row == null) {
4022         throw new IllegalArgumentException("Row cannot be null.");
4023       }
4024       boolean result = false;
4025       startRegionOperation();
4026       try {
4027         // This could be a new thread from the last time we called next().
4028         MultiVersionConsistencyControl.setThreadReadPoint(this.readPt);
4029         KeyValue kv = KeyValue.createFirstOnRow(row);
4030         // use request seek to make use of the lazy seek option. See HBASE-5520
4031         result = this.storeHeap.requestSeek(kv, true, true);
4032         if (this.joinedHeap != null) {
4033           result = this.joinedHeap.requestSeek(kv, true, true) || result;
4034         }
4035       } finally {
4036         closeRegionOperation();
4037       }
4038       return result;
4039     }

4327   /**
4328    * Inserts a new region's meta information into the passed
4329    * <code>meta</code> region. Used by the HMaster bootstrap code adding
4330    * new table to ROOT table.
4331    *
4332    * @param meta META HRegion to be updated
4333    * @param r HRegion to add to <code>meta</code>
4334    *
4335    * @throws IOException
4336    */
4337   public static void addRegionToMETA(HRegion meta, HRegion r)
4338   throws IOException {
4339     meta.checkResources();
4340     // The row key is the region name
4341     byte[] row = r.getRegionName();
4342     Integer lid = meta.obtainRowLock(row);
4343     try {
4344       final long now = EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTimeMillis();
4345       final List<KeyValue> edits = new ArrayList<KeyValue>(2);
4346       edits.add(new KeyValue(row, HConstants.CATALOG_FAMILY,
4347         HConstants.REGIONINFO_QUALIFIER, now,
4348         Writables.getBytes(r.getRegionInfo())));
4349       // Set into the root table the version of the meta table.
4350       edits.add(new KeyValue(row, HConstants.CATALOG_FAMILY,
4351         HConstants.META_VERSION_QUALIFIER, now,
4352         Bytes.toBytes(HConstants.META_VERSION)));
4353       meta.put(HConstants.CATALOG_FAMILY, edits);
4354     } finally {
4355       meta.releaseRowLock(lid);
4356     }
4357   }

4395   /**

4400    * @param row row to be checked
4401    * @return true if the row is within the range specified by the HRegionInfo
4402    */

4428   /**
4429    * Merge two HRegions.  The regions must be adjacent and must not overlap.
4430    *
4431    * @param srcA
4432    * @param srcB
4433    * @return new merged HRegion
4434    * @throws IOException
4435    */
4436   public static HRegion mergeAdjacent(final HRegion srcA, final HRegion srcB)
4437   throws IOException {
4438     HRegion a = srcA;
4439     HRegion b = srcB;
4440 
4441     // Make sure that srcA comes first; important for key-ordering during
4442     // write of the merged file.
4443     if (srcA.getStartKey() == null) {
4444       if (srcB.getStartKey() == null) {
4445         throw new IOException("Cannot merge two regions with null start key");
4446       }
4447       // A's start key is null but B's isn't. Assume A comes before B
4448     } else if ((srcB.getStartKey() == null) ||
4449       (Bytes.compareTo(srcA.getStartKey(), srcB.getStartKey()) > 0)) {
4450       a = srcB;
4451       b = srcA;
4452     }
4453 
4454     if (!(Bytes.compareTo(a.getEndKey(), b.getStartKey()) == 0)) {
4455       throw new IOException("Cannot merge non-adjacent regions");
4456     }
4457     return merge(a, b);
4458   }
4459 
4460   /**
4461    * Merge two regions whether they are adjacent or not.
4462    *
4463    * @param a region a
4464    * @param b region b
4465    * @return new merged region
4466    * @throws IOException
4467    */
4468   public static HRegion merge(HRegion a, HRegion b)
4469   throws IOException {
4470     if (!a.getRegionInfo().getTableNameAsString().equals(
4471         b.getRegionInfo().getTableNameAsString())) {
4472       throw new IOException("Regions do not belong to the same table");
4473     }
4474 
4475     FileSystem fs = a.getFilesystem();
4476 
4477     // Make sure each region's cache is empty
4478 
4479     a.flushcache();
4480     b.flushcache();
4481 
4482     // Compact each region so we only have one store file per family
4483 
4484     a.compactStores(true);
4485     if (LOG.isDebugEnabled()) {
4486       LOG.debug("Files for region: " + a);
4487       listPaths(fs, a.getRegionDir());
4488     }
4489     b.compactStores(true);
4490     if (LOG.isDebugEnabled()) {
4491       LOG.debug("Files for region: " + b);
4492       listPaths(fs, b.getRegionDir());
4493     }
4494 
4495     Configuration conf = a.getConf();
4496     HTableDescriptor tabledesc = a.getTableDesc();
4497     HLog log = a.getLog();
4498     Path tableDir = a.getTableDir();
4499     // Presume both are of same region type -- i.e. both user or catalog
4500     // table regions.  This way can use comparator.
4501     final byte[] startKey =
4502       (a.comparator.matchingRows(a.getStartKey(), 0, a.getStartKey().length,
4503            HConstants.EMPTY_BYTE_ARRAY, 0, HConstants.EMPTY_BYTE_ARRAY.length)
4504        || b.comparator.matchingRows(b.getStartKey(), 0,
4505               b.getStartKey().length, HConstants.EMPTY_BYTE_ARRAY, 0,
4506               HConstants.EMPTY_BYTE_ARRAY.length))
4507       ? HConstants.EMPTY_BYTE_ARRAY
4508       : (a.comparator.compareRows(a.getStartKey(), 0, a.getStartKey().length,
4509              b.getStartKey(), 0, b.getStartKey().length) <= 0
4510          ? a.getStartKey()
4511          : b.getStartKey());
4512     final byte[] endKey =
4513       (a.comparator.matchingRows(a.getEndKey(), 0, a.getEndKey().length,
4514            HConstants.EMPTY_BYTE_ARRAY, 0, HConstants.EMPTY_BYTE_ARRAY.length)
4515        || a.comparator.matchingRows(b.getEndKey(), 0, b.getEndKey().length,
4516               HConstants.EMPTY_BYTE_ARRAY, 0,
4517               HConstants.EMPTY_BYTE_ARRAY.length))
4518       ? HConstants.EMPTY_BYTE_ARRAY
4519       : (a.comparator.compareRows(a.getEndKey(), 0, a.getEndKey().length,
4520              b.getEndKey(), 0, b.getEndKey().length) <= 0
4521          ? b.getEndKey()
4522          : a.getEndKey());
4523 
4524     HRegionInfo newRegionInfo =
4525         new HRegionInfo(tabledesc.getName(), startKey, endKey);
4526     LOG.info("Creating new region " + newRegionInfo.toString());
4527     String encodedName = newRegionInfo.getEncodedName();
4528     Path newRegionDir = HRegion.getRegionDir(a.getTableDir(), encodedName);
4529     if(fs.exists(newRegionDir)) {
4530       throw new IOException("Cannot merge; target file collision at " +
4531           newRegionDir);
4532     }
4533     HBaseFileSystem.makeDirOnFileSystem(fs, newRegionDir);
4534 
4535     LOG.info("starting merge of regions: " + a + " and " + b +
4536       " into new region " + newRegionInfo.toString() +
4537         " with start key <" + Bytes.toStringBinary(startKey) + "> and end key <" +
4538         Bytes.toStringBinary(endKey) + ">");
4539 
4540     // Move HStoreFiles under new region directory
4541     Map<byte [], List<StoreFile>> byFamily =
4542       new TreeMap<byte [], List<StoreFile>>(Bytes.BYTES_COMPARATOR);
4543     byFamily = filesByFamily(byFamily, a.close());
4544     byFamily = filesByFamily(byFamily, b.close());
4545     for (Map.Entry<byte [], List<StoreFile>> es : byFamily.entrySet()) {
4546       byte [] colFamily = es.getKey();
4547       makeColumnFamilyDirs(fs, tableDir, newRegionInfo, colFamily);
4548       // Because we compacted the source regions we should have no more than two
4549       // HStoreFiles per family and there will be no reference store
4550       List<StoreFile> srcFiles = es.getValue();
4551       if (srcFiles.size() == 2) {
4552         long seqA = srcFiles.get(0).getMaxSequenceId();
4553         long seqB = srcFiles.get(1).getMaxSequenceId();
4554         if (seqA == seqB) {
4555           // Can't have same sequenceid since on open of a store, this is what
4556           // distingushes the files (see the map of stores how its keyed by
4557           // sequenceid).
4558           throw new IOException("Files have same sequenceid: " + seqA);
4559         }
4560       }
4561       for (StoreFile hsf: srcFiles) {
4562         StoreFile.rename(fs, hsf.getPath(),
4563           StoreFile.getUniqueFile(fs, Store.getStoreHomedir(tableDir,
4564             newRegionInfo.getEncodedName(), colFamily)));
4565       }
4566     }
4567     if (LOG.isDebugEnabled()) {
4568       LOG.debug("Files for new region");
4569       listPaths(fs, newRegionDir);
4570     }
4571     HRegion dstRegion = HRegion.newHRegion(tableDir, log, fs, conf,
4572         newRegionInfo, a.getTableDesc(), null);
4573     long totalReadRequestCount = a.readRequestsCount.get() + b.readRequestsCount.get();
4574     dstRegion.readRequestsCount.set(totalReadRequestCount);
4575     dstRegion.opMetrics.setReadRequestCountMetrics(totalReadRequestCount);
4576     
4577     long totalWriteRequestCount = a.writeRequestsCount.get() + b.writeRequestsCount.get();
4578     dstRegion.writeRequestsCount.set(totalWriteRequestCount);
4579     dstRegion.opMetrics.setWriteRequestCountMetrics(totalWriteRequestCount);
4580     
4581     dstRegion.initialize();
4582     dstRegion.compactStores();
4583     if (LOG.isDebugEnabled()) {
4584       LOG.debug("Files for new region");
4585       listPaths(fs, dstRegion.getRegionDir());
4586     }
4587 
4588     // delete out the 'A' region
4589     HFileArchiver.archiveRegion(fs, FSUtils.getRootDir(a.getConf()),
4590         a.getTableDir(), a.getRegionDir());
4591     // delete out the 'B' region
4592     HFileArchiver.archiveRegion(fs, FSUtils.getRootDir(b.getConf()),
4593         b.getTableDir(), b.getRegionDir());
4594 
4595     LOG.info("merge completed. New region is " + dstRegion);
4596 
4597     return dstRegion;
4598   }
4599 
4600   /*
4601    * Fills a map with a vector of store files keyed by column family.
4602    * @param byFamily Map to fill.
4603    * @param storeFiles Store files to process.
4604    * @param family
4605    * @return Returns <code>byFamily</code>
4606    */
4607   private static Map<byte [], List<StoreFile>> filesByFamily(
4608       Map<byte [], List<StoreFile>> byFamily, List<StoreFile> storeFiles) {
4609     for (StoreFile src: storeFiles) {
4610       byte [] family = src.getFamily();
4611       List<StoreFile> v = byFamily.get(family);
4612       if (v == null) {
4613         v = new ArrayList<StoreFile>();
4614         byFamily.put(family, v);
4615       }
4616       v.add(src);
4617     }
4618     return byFamily;
4619   }

4625   boolean isMajorCompaction() throws IOException {

4631     return false;

4635    * List the files under the specified directory
4636    *
4637    * @param fs
4638    * @param dir
4639    * @throws IOException
4640    */
4641   private static void listPaths(FileSystem fs, Path dir) throws IOException {
4642     if (LOG.isDebugEnabled()) {
4643       FileStatus[] stats = FSUtils.listStatus(fs, dir, null);
4644       if (stats == null || stats.length == 0) {
4645         return;
4646       }
4647       for (int i = 0; i < stats.length; i++) {
4648         String path = stats[i].getPath().toString();
4649         if (stats[i].isDir()) {
4650           LOG.debug("d " + path);
4651           listPaths(fs, stats[i].getPath());
4652         } else {
4653           LOG.debug("f " + path + " size=" + stats[i].getLen());
4654         }
4655       }
4656     }
4657   }

4663   /**
4664    * @param get get object
4665    * @return result
4666    * @throws IOException read exceptions
4667    */
4668   public Result get(final Get get) throws IOException {
4669     return get(get, null);
4670   }
4671 
4672   /**
4673    * @param get get object
4674    * @param lockid existing lock id, or null for no previous lock
4675    * @return result
4676    * @throws IOException read exceptions
4677    * @deprecated row locks (lockId) held outside the extent of the operation are deprecated.
4678    */
4679   public Result get(final Get get, final Integer lockid) throws IOException {
4680     checkRow(get.getRow(), "Get");
4681     // Verify families are all valid
4682     if (get.hasFamilies()) {
4683       for (byte [] family: get.familySet()) {
4684         checkFamily(family);
4685       }
4686     } else { // Adding all families to scanner
4687       for (byte[] family: this.htableDescriptor.getFamiliesKeys()) {
4688         get.addFamily(family);
4689       }
4690     }
4691     List<KeyValue> results = get(get, true);
4692     return new Result(results);
4693   }
4694 
4695   /*
4696    * Do a get based on the get parameter.
4697    * @param withCoprocessor invoke coprocessor or not. We don't want to
4698    * always invoke cp for this private method.
4699    */
4700   private List<KeyValue> get(Get get, boolean withCoprocessor)
4701   throws IOException {
4702     long now = EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTimeMillis();
4703 
4704     List<KeyValue> results = new ArrayList<KeyValue>();
4705 
4706     // pre-get CP hook
4707     if (withCoprocessor && (coprocessorHost != null)) {
4708        if (coprocessorHost.preGet(get, results)) {
4709          return results;
4710        }
4711     }
4712 
4713     Scan scan = new Scan(get);
4714 
4715     RegionScanner scanner = null;
4716     try {
4717       scanner = getScanner(scan);
4718       scanner.next(results, SchemaMetrics.METRIC_GETSIZE);
4719     } finally {
4720       if (scanner != null)
4721         scanner.close();
4722     }
4723 
4724     // post-get CP hook
4725     if (withCoprocessor && (coprocessorHost != null)) {
4726       coprocessorHost.postGet(get, results);
4727     }
4728 
4729     // do after lock
4730     final long after = EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTimeMillis();
4731     this.opMetrics.updateGetMetrics(get.familySet(), after - now);
4732 
4733     return results;
4734   }

4736   public void mutateRow(RowMutations rm) throws IOException {
4737     mutateRowsWithLocks(rm.getMutations(), Collections.singleton(rm.getRow()));
4738   }
4739 
4740   /**
4741    * Perform atomic mutations within the region.
4742    * @param mutations The list of mutations to perform.
4743    * <code>mutations</code> can contain operations for multiple rows.
4744    * Caller has to ensure that all rows are contained in this region.
4745    * @param rowsToLock Rows to lock
4746    * If multiple rows are locked care should be taken that
4747    * <code>rowsToLock</code> is sorted in order to avoid deadlocks.
4748    * @throws IOException
4749    */
4750   public void mutateRowsWithLocks(Collection<Mutation> mutations,
4751       Collection<byte[]> rowsToLock) throws IOException {
4752     boolean flush = false;
4753 
4754     checkReadOnly();
4755     checkResources();
4756 
4757     startRegionOperation();
4758     List<Integer> acquiredLocks = null;
4759     try {
4760       // 1. run all pre-hooks before the atomic operation
4761       // if any pre hook indicates "bypass", bypass the entire operation
4762 
4763       // one WALEdit is used for all edits.
4764       WALEdit walEdit = new WALEdit();
4765       if (coprocessorHost != null) {
4766         for (Mutation m : mutations) {
4767           if (m instanceof Put) {
4768             if (coprocessorHost.prePut((Put) m, walEdit, m.getWriteToWAL())) {
4769               // by pass everything
4770               return;
4771             }
4772           } else if (m instanceof Delete) {
4773             Delete d = (Delete) m;
4774             prepareDelete(d);
4775             if (coprocessorHost.preDelete(d, walEdit, d.getWriteToWAL())) {
4776               // by pass everything
4777               return;
4778             }
4779           }
4780         }
4781       }
4782 
4783       long txid = 0;
4784       boolean walSyncSuccessful = false;
4785       boolean locked = false;
4786 
4787       // 2. acquire the row lock(s)
4788       acquiredLocks = new ArrayList<Integer>(rowsToLock.size());
4789       for (byte[] row : rowsToLock) {
4790         // attempt to lock all involved rows, fail if one lock times out
4791         Integer lid = getLock(null, row, true);
4792         if (lid == null) {
4793           throw new IOException("Failed to acquire lock on "
4794               + Bytes.toStringBinary(row));
4795         }
4796         acquiredLocks.add(lid);
4797       }
4798 
4799       // 3. acquire the region lock
4800       lock(this.updatesLock.readLock(), acquiredLocks.size());
4801       locked = true;
4802 
4803       // 4. Get a mvcc write number
4804       MultiVersionConsistencyControl.WriteEntry w = mvcc.beginMemstoreInsert();
4805 
4806       long now = EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTimeMillis();
4807       byte[] byteNow = Bytes.toBytes(now);
4808       try {
4809         // 5. Check mutations and apply edits to a single WALEdit
4810         for (Mutation m : mutations) {
4811           if (m instanceof Put) {
4812             Map<byte[], List<KeyValue>> familyMap = m.getFamilyMap();
4813             checkFamilies(familyMap.keySet());
4814             checkTimestamps(familyMap, now);
4815             updateKVTimestamps(familyMap.values(), byteNow);
4816           } else if (m instanceof Delete) {
4817             Delete d = (Delete) m;
4818             prepareDelete(d);
4819             prepareDeleteTimestamps(d.getFamilyMap(), byteNow);
4820           } else {
4821             throw new DoNotRetryIOException(
4822                 "Action must be Put or Delete. But was: "
4823                     + m.getClass().getName());
4824           }
4825           if (m.getWriteToWAL()) {
4826             addFamilyMapToWALEdit(m.getFamilyMap(), walEdit);
4827           }
4828         }
4829 
4830         // 6. append all edits at once (don't sync)
4831         if (walEdit.size() > 0) {
4832           txid = this.log.appendNoSync(regionInfo,
4833               this.htableDescriptor.getName(), walEdit,
4834               HConstants.DEFAULT_CLUSTER_ID, now, this.htableDescriptor);
4835         }
4836 
4837         // 7. apply to memstore
4838         long addedSize = 0;
4839         for (Mutation m : mutations) {
4840           addedSize += applyFamilyMapToMemstore(m.getFamilyMap(), w);
4841         }
4842         flush = isFlushSize(this.addAndGetGlobalMemstoreSize(addedSize));
4843 
4844         // 8. release region and row lock(s)
4845         this.updatesLock.readLock().unlock();
4846         locked = false;
4847         if (acquiredLocks != null) {
4848           for (Integer lid : acquiredLocks) {
4849             releaseRowLock(lid);
4850           }
4851           acquiredLocks = null;
4852         }
4853 
4854         // 9. sync WAL if required
4855         if (walEdit.size() > 0) {
4856           syncOrDefer(txid);
4857         }
4858         walSyncSuccessful = true;
4859 
4860         // 10. advance mvcc
4861         mvcc.completeMemstoreInsert(w);
4862         w = null;
4863 
4864         // 11. run coprocessor post host hooks
4865         // after the WAL is sync'ed and all locks are released
4866         // (similar to doMiniBatchPut)
4867         if (coprocessorHost != null) {
4868           for (Mutation m : mutations) {
4869             if (m instanceof Put) {
4870               coprocessorHost.postPut((Put) m, walEdit, m.getWriteToWAL());
4871             } else if (m instanceof Delete) {
4872               coprocessorHost.postDelete((Delete) m, walEdit, m.getWriteToWAL());
4873             }
4874           }
4875         }
4876       } finally {
4877         // 12. clean up if needed
4878         if (!walSyncSuccessful) {
4879           int kvsRolledback = 0;
4880           for (Mutation m : mutations) {
4881             for (Map.Entry<byte[], List<KeyValue>> e : m.getFamilyMap()
4882                 .entrySet()) {
4883               List<KeyValue> kvs = e.getValue();
4884               byte[] family = e.getKey();
4885               Store store = getStore(family);
4886               // roll back each kv
4887               for (KeyValue kv : kvs) {
4888                 store.rollback(kv);
4889                 kvsRolledback++;
4890               }
4891             }
4892           }
4893           LOG.info("mutateRowWithLocks: rolled back " + kvsRolledback
4894               + " KeyValues");
4895         }
4896 
4897         if (w != null) {
4898           mvcc.completeMemstoreInsert(w);
4899         }
4900 
4901         if (locked) {
4902           this.updatesLock.readLock().unlock();
4903         }
4904 
4905         if (acquiredLocks != null) {
4906           for (Integer lid : acquiredLocks) {
4907             releaseRowLock(lid);
4908           }
4909         }
4910       }
4911     } finally {
4912       if (flush) {
4913         // 13. Flush cache if needed. Do it outside update lock.
4914         requestFlush();
4915       }
4916       closeRegionOperation();
4917     }
4918   }

4921   // to increment... See how to better unify that.

4923   /**
4924   *
4925   * Perform one or more append operations on a row.
4926   * <p>
4927   * Appends performed are done under row lock but reads do not take locks out
4928   * so this can be seen partially complete by gets and scans.
4929   *
4930   * @param append
4931   * @param writeToWAL
4932   * @return new keyvalues after increment
4933   * @throws IOException
4934   */
4935  public Result append(Append append, boolean writeToWAL)
4936      throws IOException {
4937    return append(append, null, writeToWAL);
4938  }
4939   /**
4940    *
4941    * Perform one or more append operations on a row.
4942    * <p>
4943    * Appends performed are done under row lock but reads do not take locks out
4944    * so this can be seen partially complete by gets and scans.
4945    *
4946    * @param append
4947    * @param lockid
4948    * @param writeToWAL
4949    * @return new keyvalues after increment
4950    * @throws IOException
4951    * @deprecated row locks (lockId) held outside the extent of the operation are deprecated.
4952    */
4953   public Result append(Append append, Integer lockid, boolean writeToWAL)
4954       throws IOException {
4955     // TODO: Use MVCC to make this set of appends atomic to reads
4956     byte[] row = append.getRow();
4957     checkRow(row, "append");
4958     boolean flush = false;
4959     WALEdit walEdits = null;
4960     List<KeyValue> allKVs = new ArrayList<KeyValue>(append.size());
4961     Map<Store, List<KeyValue>> tempMemstore = new HashMap<Store, List<KeyValue>>();
4962     long before = EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTimeMillis();
4963     long size = 0;
4964     long txid = 0;
4965 
4966     checkReadOnly();
4967     // Lock row
4968     startRegionOperation();
4969     this.writeRequestsCount.increment();
4970     this.opMetrics.setWriteRequestCountMetrics(this.writeRequestsCount.get());
4971     try {
4972       Integer lid = getLock(lockid, row, true);
4973       lock(this.updatesLock.readLock());
4974       try {
4975         long now = EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTimeMillis();
4976         // Process each family
4977         for (Map.Entry<byte[], List<KeyValue>> family : append.getFamilyMap()
4978             .entrySet()) {
4979 
4980           Store store = stores.get(family.getKey());
4981           List<KeyValue> kvs = new ArrayList<KeyValue>(family.getValue().size());
4982 
4983           // Get previous values for all columns in this family
4984           Get get = new Get(row);
4985           for (KeyValue kv : family.getValue()) {
4986             get.addColumn(family.getKey(), kv.getQualifier());
4987           }
4988           List<KeyValue> results = get(get, false);
4989 
4990           // Iterate the input columns and update existing values if they were
4991           // found, otherwise add new column initialized to the append value
4992 
4993           // Avoid as much copying as possible. Every byte is copied at most
4994           // once.
4995           // Would be nice if KeyValue had scatter/gather logic
4996           int idx = 0;
4997           for (KeyValue kv : family.getValue()) {
4998             KeyValue newKV;
4999             if (idx < results.size()
5000                 && results.get(idx).matchingQualifier(kv.getBuffer(),
5001                     kv.getQualifierOffset(), kv.getQualifierLength())) {
5002               KeyValue oldKv = results.get(idx);
5003               // allocate an empty kv once
5004               newKV = new KeyValue(row.length, kv.getFamilyLength(),
5005                   kv.getQualifierLength(), now, KeyValue.Type.Put,
5006                   oldKv.getValueLength() + kv.getValueLength());
5007               // copy in the value
5008               System.arraycopy(oldKv.getBuffer(), oldKv.getValueOffset(),
5009                   newKV.getBuffer(), newKV.getValueOffset(),
5010                   oldKv.getValueLength());
5011               System.arraycopy(kv.getBuffer(), kv.getValueOffset(),
5012                   newKV.getBuffer(),
5013                   newKV.getValueOffset() + oldKv.getValueLength(),
5014                   kv.getValueLength());
5015               idx++;
5016             } else {
5017               // allocate an empty kv once
5018               newKV = new KeyValue(row.length, kv.getFamilyLength(),
5019                   kv.getQualifierLength(), now, KeyValue.Type.Put,
5020                   kv.getValueLength());
5021               // copy in the value
5022               System.arraycopy(kv.getBuffer(), kv.getValueOffset(),
5023                   newKV.getBuffer(), newKV.getValueOffset(),
5024                   kv.getValueLength());
5025             }
5026             // copy in row, family, and qualifier
5027             System.arraycopy(kv.getBuffer(), kv.getRowOffset(),
5028                 newKV.getBuffer(), newKV.getRowOffset(), kv.getRowLength());
5029             System.arraycopy(kv.getBuffer(), kv.getFamilyOffset(),
5030                 newKV.getBuffer(), newKV.getFamilyOffset(),
5031                 kv.getFamilyLength());
5032             System.arraycopy(kv.getBuffer(), kv.getQualifierOffset(),
5033                 newKV.getBuffer(), newKV.getQualifierOffset(),
5034                 kv.getQualifierLength());
5035 
5036             kvs.add(newKV);
5037 
5038             // Append update to WAL
5039             if (writeToWAL) {
5040               if (walEdits == null) {
5041                 walEdits = new WALEdit();
5042               }
5043               walEdits.add(newKV);
5044             }
5045           }
5046 
5047           // store the kvs to the temporary memstore before writing HLog
5048           tempMemstore.put(store, kvs);
5049         }
5050 
5051         // Actually write to WAL now
5052         if (writeToWAL) {
5053           // Using default cluster id, as this can only happen in the orginating
5054           // cluster. A slave cluster receives the final value (not the delta)
5055           // as a Put.
5056           txid = this.log.appendNoSync(regionInfo,
5057               this.htableDescriptor.getName(), walEdits,
5058               HConstants.DEFAULT_CLUSTER_ID, EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTimeMillis(),
5059               this.htableDescriptor);
5060         }
5061         // Actually write to Memstore now
5062         for (Map.Entry<Store, List<KeyValue>> entry : tempMemstore.entrySet()) {
5063           Store store = entry.getKey();
5064           size += store.upsert(entry.getValue());
5065           allKVs.addAll(entry.getValue());
5066         }
5067         size = this.addAndGetGlobalMemstoreSize(size);
5068         flush = isFlushSize(size);
5069       } finally {
5070         this.updatesLock.readLock().unlock();
5071         releaseRowLock(lid);
5072       }
5073       if (writeToWAL) {
5074         syncOrDefer(txid); // sync the transaction log outside the rowlock
5075       }
5076     } finally {
5077       closeRegionOperation();
5078     }
5079 
5080 
5081     long after = EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTimeMillis();
5082     this.opMetrics.updateAppendMetrics(append.getFamilyMap().keySet(), after - before);
5083 
5084     if (flush) {
5085       // Request a cache flush. Do it outside update lock.
5086       requestFlush();
5087     }
5088 
5089     return append.isReturnResults() ? new Result(allKVs) : null;
5090   }

5093   *
5094   * Perform one or more increment operations on a row.
5095   * <p>
5096   * Increments performed are done under row lock but reads do not take locks
5097   * out so this can be seen partially complete by gets and scans.
5098   * @param increment
5099   * @param writeToWAL
5100   * @return new keyvalues after increment
5101   * @throws IOException
5102   */
5103   public Result increment(Increment increment, boolean writeToWAL)
5104   throws IOException {

5108   /**
5109    *
5110    * Perform one or more increment operations on a row.
5111    * <p>
5112    * Increments performed are done under row lock but reads do not take locks
5113    * out so this can be seen partially complete by gets and scans.
5114    * @param increment
5115    * @param lockid
5116    * @param writeToWAL
5117    * @return new keyvalues after increment
5118    * @throws IOException
5119    * @deprecated row locks (lockId) held outside the extent of the operation are deprecated.
5120 
5121    */
5122   public Result increment(Increment increment, Integer lockid,
5123       boolean writeToWAL)
5124   throws IOException {
5125     // TODO: Use MVCC to make this set of increments atomic to reads
5126     byte [] row = increment.getRow();
5127     checkRow(row, "increment");
5128     TimeRange tr = increment.getTimeRange();
5129     boolean flush = false;
5130     WALEdit walEdits = null;
5131     List<KeyValue> allKVs = new ArrayList<KeyValue>(increment.numColumns());
5132     Map<Store, List<KeyValue>> tempMemstore = new HashMap<Store, List<KeyValue>>();
5133     long before = EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTimeMillis();
5134     long size = 0;
5135     long txid = 0;
5136 
5137     checkReadOnly();
5138     // Lock row
5139     startRegionOperation();
5140     this.writeRequestsCount.increment();
5141     this.opMetrics.setWriteRequestCountMetrics(this.writeRequestsCount.get());
5142     try {
5143       Integer lid = getLock(lockid, row, true);
5144       lock(this.updatesLock.readLock());
5145       try {
5146         long now = EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTimeMillis();
5147         // Process each family
5148         for (Map.Entry<byte [], NavigableMap<byte [], Long>> family :
5149           increment.getFamilyMap().entrySet()) {
5150 
5151           Store store = stores.get(family.getKey());
5152           List<KeyValue> kvs = new ArrayList<KeyValue>(family.getValue().size());
5153 
5154           // Get previous values for all columns in this family
5155           Get get = new Get(row);
5156           for (Map.Entry<byte [], Long> column : family.getValue().entrySet()) {
5157             get.addColumn(family.getKey(), column.getKey());
5158           }
5159           get.setTimeRange(tr.getMin(), tr.getMax());
5160           List<KeyValue> results = get(get, false);
5161 
5162           // Iterate the input columns and update existing values if they were
5163           // found, otherwise add new column initialized to the increment amount
5164           int idx = 0;
5165           for (Map.Entry<byte [], Long> column : family.getValue().entrySet()) {
5166             long amount = column.getValue();
5167             if (idx < results.size() &&
5168                 results.get(idx).matchingQualifier(column.getKey())) {
5169               KeyValue kv = results.get(idx);
5170               if(kv.getValueLength() == Bytes.SIZEOF_LONG) {
5171                 amount += Bytes.toLong(kv.getBuffer(), kv.getValueOffset(), Bytes.SIZEOF_LONG);
5172               } else {
5173                 // throw DoNotRetryIOException instead of IllegalArgumentException
5174                 throw new DoNotRetryIOException(
5175                     "Attempted to increment field that isn't 64 bits wide");
5176               }
5177               idx++;
5178             }
5179 
5180             // Append new incremented KeyValue to list
5181             KeyValue newKV = new KeyValue(row, family.getKey(), column.getKey(),
5182                 now, Bytes.toBytes(amount));
5183             kvs.add(newKV);
5184 
5185             // Prepare WAL updates
5186             if (writeToWAL) {
5187               if (walEdits == null) {
5188                 walEdits = new WALEdit();
5189               }
5190               walEdits.add(newKV);
5191             }
5192           }
5193 
5194           //store the kvs to the temporary memstore before writing HLog
5195           tempMemstore.put(store, kvs);
5196         }
5197 
5198         // Actually write to WAL now
5199         if (writeToWAL) {
5200           // Using default cluster id, as this can only happen in the orginating
5201           // cluster. A slave cluster receives the final value (not the delta)
5202           // as a Put.
5203           txid = this.log.appendNoSync(regionInfo, this.htableDescriptor.getName(),
5204               walEdits, HConstants.DEFAULT_CLUSTER_ID, EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTimeMillis(),
5205               this.htableDescriptor);
5206         }
5207 
5208         //Actually write to Memstore now
5209         for (Map.Entry<Store, List<KeyValue>> entry : tempMemstore.entrySet()) {
5210           Store store = entry.getKey();
5211           size += store.upsert(entry.getValue());
5212           allKVs.addAll(entry.getValue());
5213         }
5214         size = this.addAndGetGlobalMemstoreSize(size);
5215         flush = isFlushSize(size);
5216       } finally {
5217         this.updatesLock.readLock().unlock();
5218         releaseRowLock(lid);
5219       }
5220       if (writeToWAL) {
5221         syncOrDefer(txid); // sync the transaction log outside the rowlock
5222       }
5223     } finally {
5224       closeRegionOperation();
5225       long after = EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTimeMillis();
5226       this.opMetrics.updateIncrementMetrics(increment.getFamilyMap().keySet(), after - before);
5227     }
5228 
5229     if (flush) {
5230       // Request a cache flush.  Do it outside update lock.
5231       requestFlush();
5232     }
5233 
5234     return new Result(allKVs);
5235   }

5237   /**
5238    * @param row
5239    * @param family
5240    * @param qualifier
5241    * @param amount
5242    * @param writeToWAL
5243    * @return The new value.
5244    * @throws IOException
5245    */
5246   public long incrementColumnValue(byte [] row, byte [] family,
5247       byte [] qualifier, long amount, boolean writeToWAL)
5248   throws IOException {
5249     // to be used for metrics
5250     long before = EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTimeMillis();
5251 
5252     checkRow(row, "increment");
5253     boolean flush = false;
5254     boolean wrongLength = false;
5255     long txid = 0;
5256     // Lock row
5257     long result = amount;
5258     startRegionOperation();
5259     this.writeRequestsCount.increment();
5260     this.opMetrics.setWriteRequestCountMetrics(this.writeRequestsCount.get());
5261     try {
5262       Integer lid = obtainRowLock(row);
5263       lock(this.updatesLock.readLock());
5264       try {
5265         Store store = stores.get(family);
5266 
5267         // Get the old value:
5268         Get get = new Get(row);
5269         get.addColumn(family, qualifier);
5270 
5271         // we don't want to invoke coprocessor in this case; ICV is wrapped
5272         // in HRegionServer, so we leave getLastIncrement alone
5273         List<KeyValue> results = get(get, false);
5274 
5275         if (!results.isEmpty()) {
5276           KeyValue kv = results.get(0);
5277           if(kv.getValueLength() == Bytes.SIZEOF_LONG){
5278             byte [] buffer = kv.getBuffer();
5279             int valueOffset = kv.getValueOffset();
5280             result += Bytes.toLong(buffer, valueOffset, Bytes.SIZEOF_LONG);
5281           }
5282           else{
5283             wrongLength = true;
5284           }
5285         }
5286         if(!wrongLength){
5287           // build the KeyValue now:
5288           KeyValue newKv = new KeyValue(row, family,
5289             qualifier, EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTimeMillis(),
5290             Bytes.toBytes(result));
5291 
5292           // now log it:
5293           if (writeToWAL) {
5294             long now = EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTimeMillis();
5295             WALEdit walEdit = new WALEdit();
5296             walEdit.add(newKv);
5297             // Using default cluster id, as this can only happen in the
5298             // orginating cluster. A slave cluster receives the final value (not
5299             // the delta) as a Put.
5300             txid = this.log.appendNoSync(regionInfo, this.htableDescriptor.getName(),
5301                 walEdit, HConstants.DEFAULT_CLUSTER_ID, now,
5302                 this.htableDescriptor);
5303           }
5304 
5305           // Now request the ICV to the store, this will set the timestamp
5306           // appropriately depending on if there is a value in memcache or not.
5307           // returns the change in the size of the memstore from operation
5308           long size = store.updateColumnValue(row, family, qualifier, result);
5309 
5310           size = this.addAndGetGlobalMemstoreSize(size);
5311           flush = isFlushSize(size);
5312         }
5313       } finally {
5314         this.updatesLock.readLock().unlock();
5315         releaseRowLock(lid);
5316       }
5317       if (writeToWAL) {
5318         syncOrDefer(txid); // sync the transaction log outside the rowlock
5319       }
5320     } finally {
5321       closeRegionOperation();
5322     }
5323 
5324     // do after lock
5325     long after = EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTimeMillis();
5326     this.opMetrics.updateIncrementColumnValueMetrics(family, after - before);
5327 
5328     if (flush) {
5329       // Request a cache flush.  Do it outside update lock.
5330       requestFlush();
5331     }
5332     if(wrongLength){
5333       throw new DoNotRetryIOException(
5334           "Attempted to increment field that isn't 64 bits wide");
5335     }
5336     return result;
5337   }

5353   public static final long FIXED_OVERHEAD = ClassSize.align(
5354       ClassSize.OBJECT +
5355       ClassSize.ARRAY +
5356       35 * ClassSize.REFERENCE + 2 * Bytes.SIZEOF_INT +
5357       (7 * Bytes.SIZEOF_LONG) +
5358       Bytes.SIZEOF_BOOLEAN);
5359 
5360   public static final long DEEP_OVERHEAD = FIXED_OVERHEAD +
5361       ClassSize.OBJECT + // closeLock
5362       (2 * ClassSize.ATOMIC_BOOLEAN) + // closed, closing
5363       (3 * ClassSize.ATOMIC_LONG) + // memStoreSize, numPutsWithoutWAL, dataInMemoryWithoutWAL
5364       ClassSize.ATOMIC_INTEGER + // lockIdGenerator
5365       (3 * ClassSize.CONCURRENT_HASHMAP) +  // lockedRows, lockIds, scannerReadPoints
5366       WriteState.HEAP_SIZE + // writestate
5367       ClassSize.CONCURRENT_SKIPLISTMAP + ClassSize.CONCURRENT_SKIPLISTMAP_ENTRY + // stores
5368       (2 * ClassSize.REENTRANT_LOCK) + // lock, updatesLock
5369       ClassSize.ARRAYLIST + // recentFlushes
5370       MultiVersionConsistencyControl.FIXED_SIZE // mvcc
5371       ;
5372 
5373   @Override
5374   public long heapSize() {
5375     long heapSize = DEEP_OVERHEAD;
5376     for(Store store : this.stores.values()) {
5377       heapSize += store.heapSize();
5378     }
5379     // this does not take into account row locks, recent flushes, mvcc entries
5380     return heapSize;
5381   }

5397   /**
5398    * Registers a new CoprocessorProtocol subclass and instance to
5399    * be available for handling {@link HRegion#exec(Exec)} calls.
5400    *
5401    * <p>
5402    * Only a single protocol type/handler combination may be registered per
5403    * region.
5404    * After the first registration, subsequent calls with the same protocol type
5405    * will fail with a return value of {@code false}.
5406    * </p>
5407    * @param protocol a {@code CoprocessorProtocol} subinterface defining the
5408    * protocol methods
5409    * @param handler an instance implementing the interface
5410    * @param <T> the protocol type
5411    * @return {@code true} if the registration was successful, {@code false}
5412    * otherwise
5413    */
5414   public <T extends CoprocessorProtocol> boolean registerProtocol(
5415       Class<T> protocol, T handler) {
5416 
5417     /* No stacking of protocol handlers is currently allowed.  The
5418      * first to claim wins!
5419      */
5420     if (protocolHandlers.containsKey(protocol)) {
5421       LOG.error("Protocol "+protocol.getName()+
5422           " already registered, rejecting request from "+
5423           handler
5424       );
5425       return false;
5426     }
5427 
5428     protocolHandlers.putInstance(protocol, handler);
5429     protocolHandlerNames.put(protocol.getName(), protocol);
5430     if (LOG.isDebugEnabled()) {
5431       LOG.debug("Registered protocol handler: region="+
5432           Bytes.toStringBinary(getRegionName())+" protocol="+protocol.getName());
5433     }
5434     return true;
5435   }
5436 
5437   /**
5438    * Executes a single {@link org.apache.hadoop.hbase.ipc.CoprocessorProtocol}
5439    * method using the registered protocol handlers.
5440    * {@link CoprocessorProtocol} implementations must be registered via the
5441    * {@link org.apache.hadoop.hbase.regionserver.HRegion#registerProtocol(Class, org.apache.hadoop.hbase.ipc.CoprocessorProtocol)}
5442    * method before they are available.
5443    *
5444    * @param call an {@code Exec} instance identifying the protocol, method name,
5445    *     and parameters for the method invocation
5446    * @return an {@code ExecResult} instance containing the region name of the
5447    *     invocation and the return value
5448    * @throws IOException if no registered protocol handler is found or an error
5449    *     occurs during the invocation
5450    * @see org.apache.hadoop.hbase.regionserver.HRegion#registerProtocol(Class, org.apache.hadoop.hbase.ipc.CoprocessorProtocol)
5451    */
5452   public ExecResult exec(Exec call)
5453       throws IOException {
5454     Class<? extends CoprocessorProtocol> protocol = call.getProtocol();
5455     if (protocol == null) {
5456       String protocolName = call.getProtocolName();
5457       if (LOG.isDebugEnabled()) {
5458         LOG.debug("Received dynamic protocol exec call with protocolName " + protocolName);
5459       }
5460       // detect the actual protocol class
5461       protocol  = protocolHandlerNames.get(protocolName);
5462       if (protocol == null) {
5463         throw new HBaseRPC.UnknownProtocolException(protocol,
5464             "No matching handler for protocol "+protocolName+
5465             " in region "+Bytes.toStringBinary(getRegionName()));
5466       }
5467     }
5468     if (!protocolHandlers.containsKey(protocol)) {
5469       throw new HBaseRPC.UnknownProtocolException(protocol,
5470           "No matching handler for protocol "+protocol.getName()+
5471           " in region "+Bytes.toStringBinary(getRegionName()));
5472     }
5473 
5474     CoprocessorProtocol handler = protocolHandlers.getInstance(protocol);
5475     Object value;
5476 
5477     try {
5478       Method method = protocol.getMethod(
5479           call.getMethodName(), call.getParameterClasses());
5480       method.setAccessible(true);
5481 
5482       value = method.invoke(handler, call.getParameters());
5483     } catch (InvocationTargetException e) {
5484       Throwable target = e.getTargetException();
5485       if (target instanceof IOException) {
5486         throw (IOException)target;
5487       }
5488       IOException ioe = new IOException(target.toString());
5489       ioe.setStackTrace(target.getStackTrace());
5490       throw ioe;
5491     } catch (Throwable e) {
5492       if (!(e instanceof IOException)) {
5493         LOG.error("Unexpected throwable object ", e);
5494       }
5495       IOException ioe = new IOException(e.toString());
5496       ioe.setStackTrace(e.getStackTrace());
5497       throw ioe;
5498     }
5499 
5500     return new ExecResult(getRegionName(), value);
5501   }

5503   /*
5504    * Process table.
5505    * Do major compaction or list content.
5506    * @param fs
5507    * @param p
5508    * @param log
5509    * @param c
5510    * @param majorCompact
5511    * @throws IOException
5512    */
5513   private static void processTable(final FileSystem fs, final Path p,
5514       final HLog log, final Configuration c,
5515       final boolean majorCompact)
5516   throws IOException {
5517     HRegion region = null;
5518     String rootStr = Bytes.toString(HConstants.ROOT_TABLE_NAME);
5519     String metaStr = Bytes.toString(HConstants.META_TABLE_NAME);
5520     // Currently expects tables have one region only.
5521     if (p.getName().startsWith(rootStr)) {
5522       region = HRegion.newHRegion(p, log, fs, c, HRegionInfo.ROOT_REGIONINFO,
5523         HTableDescriptor.ROOT_TABLEDESC, null);
5524     } else if (p.getName().startsWith(metaStr)) {
5525       region = HRegion.newHRegion(p, log, fs, c,
5526         HRegionInfo.FIRST_META_REGIONINFO, HTableDescriptor.META_TABLEDESC, null);
5527     } else {
5528       throw new IOException("Not a known catalog table: " + p.toString());
5529     }
5530     try {
5531       region.initialize();
5532       if (majorCompact) {
5533         region.compactStores(true);
5534       } else {
5535         // Default behavior
5536         Scan scan = new Scan();
5537         // scan.addFamily(HConstants.CATALOG_FAMILY);
5538         RegionScanner scanner = region.getScanner(scan);
5539         try {
5540           List<KeyValue> kvs = new ArrayList<KeyValue>();
5541           boolean done = false;
5542           do {
5543             kvs.clear();
5544             done = scanner.next(kvs);
5545             if (kvs.size() > 0) LOG.info(kvs);
5546           } while (done);
5547         } finally {
5548           scanner.close();
5549         }
5550       }
5551     } finally {
5552       region.close();
5553     }
5554   }

5584   /**
5585    * Return the splitpoint. null indicates the region isn't splittable
5586    * If the splitpoint isn't explicitly specified, it will go over the stores
5587    * to find the best splitpoint. Currently the criteria of best splitpoint
5588    * is based on the size of the store.
5589    */
5590   public byte[] checkSplit() {
5591     // Can't split ROOT/META
5592     if (this.regionInfo.isMetaTable()) {
5593       if (shouldForceSplit()) {
5594         LOG.warn("Cannot split root/meta regions in HBase 0.20 and above");
5595       }
5596       return null;
5597     }
5598 
5599     if (!splitPolicy.shouldSplit()) {
5600       return null;
5601     }
5602 
5603     byte[] ret = splitPolicy.getSplitPoint();
5604 
5605     if (ret != null) {
5606       try {
5607         checkRow(ret, "calculated split");
5608       } catch (IOException e) {
5609         LOG.error("Ignoring invalid split", e);
5610         return null;
5611       }
5612     }
5613     return ret;
5614   }

5669   /**
5670    * This method needs to be called before any public call that reads or
5671    * modifies data. It has to be called just before a try.
5672    * #closeRegionOperation needs to be called in the try's finally block
5673    * Acquires a read lock and checks if the region is closing or closed.
5674    * @throws NotServingRegionException when the region is closing or closed
5675    * @throws RegionTooBusyException if failed to get the lock in time
5676    * @throws InterruptedIOException if interrupted while waiting for a lock
5677    */
5678   public void startRegionOperation()
5679       throws NotServingRegionException, RegionTooBusyException, InterruptedIOException {
5680     if (this.closing.get()) {
5681       throw new NotServingRegionException(regionInfo.getRegionNameAsString() +
5682           " is closing");
5683     }
5684     lock(lock.readLock());
5685     if (this.closed.get()) {
5686       lock.readLock().unlock();
5687       throw new NotServingRegionException(regionInfo.getRegionNameAsString() +
5688           " is closed");
5689     }
5690   }
5691 
5692   /**
5693    * Closes the lock. This needs to be called in the finally block corresponding
5694    * to the try block of #startRegionOperation
5695    */
5696   public void closeRegionOperation(){
5697     lock.readLock().unlock();
5698   }
5699 
5700   /**
5701    * This method needs to be called before any public call that reads or
5702    * modifies stores in bulk. It has to be called just before a try.
5703    * #closeBulkRegionOperation needs to be called in the try's finally block
5704    * Acquires a writelock and checks if the region is closing or closed.
5705    * @throws NotServingRegionException when the region is closing or closed
5706    * @throws RegionTooBusyException if failed to get the lock in time
5707    * @throws InterruptedIOException if interrupted while waiting for a lock
5708    */
5709   private void startBulkRegionOperation(boolean writeLockNeeded)
5710       throws NotServingRegionException, RegionTooBusyException, InterruptedIOException {
5711     if (this.closing.get()) {
5712       throw new NotServingRegionException(regionInfo.getRegionNameAsString() +
5713           " is closing");
5714     }
5715     if (writeLockNeeded) lock(lock.writeLock());
5716     else lock(lock.readLock());
5717     if (this.closed.get()) {
5718       if (writeLockNeeded) lock.writeLock().unlock();
5719       else lock.readLock().unlock();
5720       throw new NotServingRegionException(regionInfo.getRegionNameAsString() +
5721           " is closed");
5722     }
5723   }
5724 
5725   /**
5726    * Closes the lock. This needs to be called in the finally block corresponding
5727    * to the try block of #startRegionOperation
5728    */
5729   private void closeBulkRegionOperation() {
5730     if (lock.writeLock().isHeldByCurrentThread()) lock.writeLock().unlock();
5731     else lock.readLock().unlock();
5732   }

5734   /**
5735    * Update counters for numer of puts without wal and the size of possible data loss.
5736    * These information are exposed by the region server metrics.
5737    */
5738   private void recordPutWithoutWal(final Map<byte [], List<KeyValue>> familyMap) {
5739     if (numPutsWithoutWAL.getAndIncrement() == 0) {
5740       LOG.info("writing data to region " + this +
5741                " with WAL disabled. Data may be lost in the event of a crash.");
5742     }
5743 
5744     long putSize = 0;
5745     for (List<KeyValue> edits : familyMap.values()) {
5746       for (KeyValue kv : edits) {
5747         putSize += kv.getKeyLength() + kv.getValueLength();
5748       }
5749     }
5750 
5751     dataInMemoryWithoutWAL.addAndGet(putSize);
5752   }

5754   private void lock(final Lock lock)
5755       throws RegionTooBusyException, InterruptedIOException {
5756     lock(lock, 1);
5757   }
5758 
5759   /**
5760    * Try to acquire a lock.  Throw RegionTooBusyException
5761    * if failed to get the lock in time. Throw InterruptedIOException
5762    * if interrupted while waiting for the lock.
5763    */
5764   private void lock(final Lock lock, final int multiplier)
5765       throws RegionTooBusyException, InterruptedIOException {
5766     try {
5767       final long waitTime = Math.min(maxBusyWaitDuration,
5768         busyWaitDuration * Math.min(multiplier, maxBusyWaitMultiplier));
5769       if (!lock.tryLock(waitTime, TimeUnit.MILLISECONDS)) {
5770         throw new RegionTooBusyException(
5771           "failed to get a lock in " + waitTime + "ms");
5772       }
5773     } catch (InterruptedException ie) {
5774       LOG.info("Interrupted while waiting for a lock");
5775       InterruptedIOException iie = new InterruptedIOException();
5776       iie.initCause(ie);
5777       throw iie;
5778     }
5779   }

5783    * deferring it.
5784    * @param txid should sync up to which transaction
5785    * @throws IOException If anything goes wrong with DFS
5786    */
5787   private void syncOrDefer(long txid) throws IOException {
5788     if (this.regionInfo.isMetaRegion() ||
5789       !this.htableDescriptor.isDeferredLogFlush() || this.deferredLogSyncDisabled) {
5790       this.log.sync(txid);

5820   /**
5821    * Facility for dumping and compacting catalog tables.
5822    * Only does catalog tables since these are only tables we for sure know
5823    * schema on.  For usage run:
5824    * <pre>
5825    *   ./bin/hbase org.apache.hadoop.hbase.regionserver.HRegion
5826    * </pre>
5827    * @param args
5828    * @throws IOException
5829    */
5830   public static void main(String[] args) throws IOException {
5831     if (args.length < 1) {
5832       printUsageAndExit(null);
5833     }
5834     boolean majorCompact = false;
5835     if (args.length > 1) {
5836       if (!args[1].toLowerCase().startsWith("major")) {
5837         printUsageAndExit("ERROR: Unrecognized option <" + args[1] + ">");
5838       }
5839       majorCompact = true;
5840     }
5841     final Path tableDir = new Path(args[0]);
5842     final Configuration c = HBaseConfiguration.create();
5843     final FileSystem fs = FileSystem.get(c);
5844     final Path logdir = new Path(c.get("hbase.tmp.dir"),
5845         "hlog" + tableDir.getName()
5846         + EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTimeMillis());
5847     final Path oldLogDir = new Path(c.get("hbase.tmp.dir"),
5848         HConstants.HREGION_OLDLOGDIR_NAME);
5849     final HLog log = new HLog(fs, logdir, oldLogDir, c);
5850     try {
5851       processTable(fs, tableDir, log, c, majorCompact);
5852     } finally {
5853        log.close();
5854        // TODO: is this still right?
5855        BlockCache bc = new CacheConfig(c).getBlockCache();
5856        if (bc != null) bc.shutdown();
5857     }
5858   }
